analyzed: gang du sti'i sgra yin pa de la ri yig rjes su 'brel pa nyid las a'i'o //

original: bh'a t'i stri /
analyzed: bh'a t'i stri /

analyzed: bh'ant'i str'i / de bzhin du /

original: sn'a t'i / sna'ant'i /
analyzed: sn'a t'i / sna'ant'i /

original: bha gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: bha gsal ba la'o //

original: shna dag pa la'o //
analyzed: shna dag pa la'o //

original: shantring'o // aan\ bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: shantring'o // aan\ bi ka ra na'o //

analyzed: aad\ sosg las 'jig go //

analyzed: gang 'di'i bh'a sogs sgra'i sogs pa'i sgra de ni rnam pa'i don la ste /

original: rnam pa'ang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'ang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The suffix also means similar.

original: des na bh'a zhes pa 'dis gang 'dra ba byings aa yig gi mtha' can de rnams thams cad de rnams thams cad bh'a sogs smos pas gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na bh'a zhes pa 'dis gang 'dra ba byings aa yig gi mtha' can de rnams thams cad de rnams thams cad bh'a sogs smos pas gzung bar bya ba'o //

original: des na y'at'i /
analyzed: des na y'at'i /

original: y'ant'i ; ya 'thob pa la'o //
analyzed: y'ant'i ; ya 'thob pa la'o //

original: bha w'ant'i / d'i byant'i /
analyzed: bha w'ant'i / d'i byant'i /

original: 'o na aa nu sham ga'ang krunytsa dang ait\ ma yin pa'i 'o zhes pa 'dis rtag tu dbyi bar tsa'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na aa nu sham ga'ang krunytsa dang ait\ ma yin pa'i 'o zhes pa 'dis rtag tu dbyi bar tsa'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

original: yang na smos pa rjes su 'brel te /
analyzed: yang na smos pa rjes su 'brel te /

original: de'ang rnam par gzhag pa rnam par bshad par bya ba las so //
analyzed: de'ang rnam par gzhag pa rnam par bshad par bya ba las so //
translated: And that is from the explanation of the presentation.

original: des na aan dang yin gyi bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aanti'i na ne ai yig pha rol la dbyi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na aan dang yin gyi bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aanti'i na ne ai yig pha rol la dbyi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, from the aṇ and the iṇ of the other aṇti, the i vowel is not elided on the other side from the vikaraṇa.

original: sya'i sgra las pha rol gyi aanti'i na ni ai gig pha rol la dbyi bar yang na bshad par bya ste /🔽ka ri shya t'i /
analyzed: sya'i sgra las pha rol gyi aanti'i na ni ai gig pha rol la dbyi bar yang na bshad par bya ste / ka ri shya t'i /
translated: From the word sya, the iṇ of the other aṇti is the i vowel, and it is also elided on the other side.🔽karīṣyati

original: ka ri shyant'i /
analyzed: ka ri shyant'i /

original: du kri nya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du kri nya byed pa la'o //

original: shantring @101b dang ; / aa na sya lhan cig pa dag go zhes pas sya dang lhan cig pa'i shantringa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: shantring @101b dang ; / aa na sya lhan cig pa dag go zhes pas sya dang lhan cig pa'i shantringa'i rkyen no //
translated: The condition of śaṅtriṅ is together with sya.

original: han dang rit\ mtha' las kyang bya la'o zhes pa aita'o //
analyzed: han dang rit\ mtha' las kyang bya la'o zhes pa aita'o //

original: ha ni'i hi'i ghi au pa dh'a byis pa la'o //
analyzed: ha ni'i hi'i ghi au pa dh'a byis pa la'o //
translated: The iṇ of haṇi is the iṇ of hī and ghi for the child.

original: ha ni hi 'tshe ba dang 'gro ba dag la'o zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha can 'di'i ha yig gang yin pa de'i au pa dh'a dbyi ba byas par gyur pa na gha nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha ni hi 'tshe ba dang 'gro ba dag la'o zhes pa kvi pa'i mtha can 'di'i ha yig gang yin pa de'i au pa dh'a dbyi ba byas par gyur pa na gha nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The ha of this one ending in kvip becomes gha when the upapada is elided.

original: gnas can dang bsgyur bdag gi ai yig brjod pa'i don do //
analyzed: gnas can dang bsgyur bdag gi ai yig brjod pa'i don do //
translated: The i of the locative is expressed by the word “of.”

original: bri tra ghna /
analyzed: bri tra ghna /

original: bri tra bcom mo zhes pas kvipa\'o //
analyzed: bri tra bcom mo zhes pas kvipa\'o //
translated: Bhrītri is conquered, thus kvip.

original: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //

original: au pa dh'a phyis pa zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽bri tra ha noo:/
analyzed: au pa dh'a phyis pa zhes pa ci zhe na / bri tra ha noo:/
translated: What is the elided upapada?🔽Bhrītri ha noḥ.

original: bri tra ha na:/
analyzed: bri tra ha na:/
translated: Bhrītri ha noḥ.

original: 'o na au pa dh'a byis pa'i 'o zhes pa 'dis gha nyid du grub po zhes pas ci'i phyir sbyor ba brtsams te don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na au pa dh'a byis pa'i 'o zhes pa 'dis gha nyid du grub po zhes pas ci'i phyir sbyor ba brtsams te don med do zhe na /
translated: Well then, since gha is established by this “upapada is elided,” why did you begin the application? It is meaningless.

original: brjod par bya ste byings kyi bya ba brjod pa ni byings kyi rkyen kho na la 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig las si la sogs pa rnams la yod pa'i gha nyid 'thob pa ma yin no zhes par sbyor ba brtsams so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste byings kyi bya ba brjod pa ni byings kyi rkyen kho na la 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig las si la sogs pa rnams la yod pa'i gha nyid 'thob pa ma yin no zhes par sbyor ba brtsams so //
translated: I will explain. The statement “The function of a verbal root is only a verbal-root affix” is the beginning of the application of the rule that the gha that exists in the root si is not obtained.

original: gal te byings kyi bya ba'ang rtags kyi rkyen la'ang 'gyur na gi ri'i gi ra'o zhes pa 'dir dbyangs la yang na'o zhes pas la nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽go'i ghut la aoo'o //🔽go'i sgra ghut pha rol la aoo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byings kyi bya ba'ang rtags kyi rkyen la'ang 'gyur na gi ri'i gi ra'o zhes pa 'dir dbyangs la yang na'o zhes pas la nyid du 'gyur ro // go'i ghut la aoo'o // go'i sgra ghut pha rol la aoo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the function of a verbal root were also a secondary suffix, then in the statement “gir of giri,” the vowel would be na by the rule “On la,” and it would become la.🔽The sound go of ghaṭa becomes o.🔽The sound go of ghaṭa becomes o.

original: goo:/ g'a woo /
analyzed: goo:/ g'a woo /
translated: The sound go of ghaṭa becomes o.

original: g'a wa:/ ghut la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: g'a wa:/ ghut la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ghaṭa?

original: go bhi:/ bya'o sgra las kyang 'dod de /🔽dyoo:/ dya woo /
analyzed: go bhi:/ bya'o sgra las kyang 'dod de / dyoo:/ dya woo /
translated: It is also asserted from the word “to do.”🔽The sound dya of dyaur becomes o.

original: dya wa:/ aam\ shas dag la a'a'o //🔽go'i sgra'i aam\ shas\ pha rol la a'a nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dya wa:/ aam\ shas dag la a'a'o // go'i sgra'i aam\ shas\ pha rol la a'a nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound dya of dyaur becomes o.🔽The sound dya of dyaur becomes o.🔽The sound am of the sound go becomes a.🔽The sound am of the sound go becomes a.

original: g'am\/ g'a:/ dyo'i sgra las kyang 'dod do //
analyzed: g'am\/ g'a:/ dyo'i sgra las kyang 'dod do //
translated: The sound go of ghaṭa becomes a.🔽It is also asserted from the word “to do.”

original: dy'am\/ dy'a:/ panthi manthi ri bhukshi rnams kyi si la'o //
analyzed: dy'am\/ dy'a:/ panthi manthi ri bhukshi rnams kyi si la'o //
translated: paṃthimantri-bhukṣīnām silā.

original: pam thi dang / manthi dang / ri bhakshi dang de rnams ni panthi manthi ri bhukshi rnams so //
analyzed: pam thi dang / manthi dang / ri bhakshi dang de rnams ni panthi manthi ri bhukshi rnams so //
translated: Paṃthi, Mantri, and Bhukṣi are the Paṃthi-Mantri-Bhukṣis.

original: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi zhes pa 'di rnams kyi si pha rol la a'a nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi zhes pa 'di rnams kyi si pha rol la a'a nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllable silā is added to the end of these, Paṃthi, Mantri, and Bhukṣi.

original: pantha:/ manth'a:/ ri bhuk'a:/
analyzed: pantha:/ manth'a:/ ri bhuk'a:/
translated: paṃthāḥ, mantri, bhukṣāḥ.

original: si la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: si la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is silā?

original: pa thi bhi:/ gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi na'o zhes pas na dbyi'o //
analyzed: pa thi bhi:/ gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi na'o zhes pas na dbyi'o //
translated: The sibilants are also the sibilants of these.

original: ghut la aan\ mtha'o //
analyzed: ghut la aan\ mtha'o //
translated: ghutāṃ,

original: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi mtha' ghut pha rol la aan du bsgyur ba 'thob bbo //
analyzed: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi mtha' ghut pha rol la aan du bsgyur ba 'thob bbo //
translated: The final ghut of Paṃthi, Mantri, and Bhukṣi is changed to ān on the other side.

original: bantha'a / panth'a noo /🔽panth'a na:/ panth'a nam\/
analyzed: bantha'a / panth'a noo / panth'a na:/ panth'a nam\/
translated: paṃthā, paṃthān,🔽paṃthānāḥ, paṃthānām,🔽paṃthānāḥ.

original: panth'a noo / de bzhin du /
analyzed: panth'a noo / de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: manth'a / manth'a noo /🔽mam th'a na:/ mam th'a na ma:/
analyzed: manth'a / manth'a noo / mam th'a na:/ mam th'a na ma:/
translated: mantra, mantrāṇ,🔽mantriṇāḥ, mantriṇām,

original: mam th'a noo /🔽ri bhu ksh'a /
analyzed: mam th'a noo / ri bhu ksh'a /
translated: mantriṇāḥ.🔽bhukṣā,

original: riksha noo / ri bhuksha na:/
analyzed: riksha noo / ri bhuksha na:/
translated: rikṣāṇ, bhukṣiṇāḥ,🔽bhukṣiṇām,

original: ri bhu ksh'a nam\/
analyzed: ri bhu ksh'a nam\/
translated: bhukṣiṇāḥ.

original: ri bhuksh'a noo /
analyzed: ri bhuksh'a noo /
translated: Ribhukshanau.

original: ghut la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ghut la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by gutta?

original: pa thi shu /
analyzed: pa thi shu /
translated: Pathishu.
Matishu.

original: thi shu ; ri bhukshi shu /
analyzed: thi shu ; ri bhukshi shu /
translated: Ribhukshishu.

original: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o //
translated: The gutturals are the vowels.

original: ghut ma yin pa zhes pa bdun pa'i tshig phyis pa'o //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa zhes pa bdun pa'i tshig phyis pa'o //
translated: The gutturals are the seven cases.

original: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi mtha' dbyi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi mtha' dbyi bar 'gyur te /
translated: The final of panthih, manthih, and ribhukshis becomes i.

original: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la'o //🔽pa tha:/ pa th'a /
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la'o // pa tha:/ pa th'a /
translated: The gutturals are the vowels.🔽Pathash.🔽Pathash.

original: pa the / ma tha:/
analyzed: pa the / ma tha:/
translated: Pathas.🔽Matash.🔽Matash.

original: ma th'a / ma the ;
analyzed: ma th'a / ma the ;
translated: Matas.🔽Ribhukshash.

original: ri bhuksh'a:/ ri bhuksh'a /
analyzed: ri bhuksh'a:/ ri bhuksh'a /
translated: Ribhukshash.🔽Ribhukshas.

original: ri bhukshe / dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ri bhukshe / dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: pa thi shu /
analyzed: pa thi shu /
translated: Pathishu.

original: ma thi shu /
analyzed: ma thi shu /
translated: Matishu.

original: ghut ma yin pa smos pa ni phyi ma'i don to //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa smos pa ni phyi ma'i don to //
translated: The mention of the gutturals is for the sake of the next.

original: 'dir ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs kho na la dbyi bar rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs kho na la dbyi bar rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, only the gutturals are to be known as the vowels.

original: ghut la gzhan du bsgyur bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ghut la gzhan du bsgyur bar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the gutturals are transformed into the other vowels.

original: gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi na'o //
analyzed: gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi na'o //
translated: And these are the nasals of the gutturals.

original: panth'i sogs kyi dbyangs dang gsal la byed pha rol la na yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: panth'i sogs kyi dbyangs dang gsal la byed pha rol la na yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The vowel sound of the Panthā etc. is clear, and the na is elided.

original: ghut ma yin pa smos pa ni gnyis ka dag gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa smos pa ni gnyis ka dag gi khyad par ro //
translated: The mention of not-ghuta is the distinction of both.

analyzed: lam pas smra ba byed do // srub pa pos smra bar byed do zhes byings don la ain te k'a ri ta'o zhes pas aina\'o //

analyzed: ain la rtags kyi zhes pas ai yig dbyi zhing 'dis na yig dbyi'o //

analyzed: si la nu'o zhes pa 'di las gong du rjes su 'jug go //

analyzed: krunytsi ma yin pa la ste /

original: bi du she /
analyzed: bi du she /

original: 'o na nang gi yan lag ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sde pa la sde pa'i mtha'o zhes bas na yig sde ba'i mthar byas pa la aa nu sham ga'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes krunytsa las kyis bkag pas so zhe na ;

analyzed: ri ka:/ sgrol lo spyod do'ang ai kan zhes pas ai kana'o //

analyzed: gang gi dga' ba bzhi rnams yin pa de dga' ba bzhi rnams so //

analyzed: brtsegs pa'i mtha' dbyi'o ; / aa na dv'a hoo /

original: aa na dv'a h'a:/
analyzed: aa na dv'a h'a:/
translated: The o is from anadvaha and anadvaha.

analyzed: aa na dva ha'i bud med kyi yul la w'a sgra'i au nyid du yang na bshad par bya ste / aa na du h'i /
translated: Or it should be explained as the feminine of anandhava, with the u vowel.🔽ananduh

original: aa na dv'a h'i /
analyzed: aa na dv'a h'i /
translated: anandāhi

original: go ra sogs kyi zhes pas a'i'i rkyen no //
analyzed: go ra sogs kyi zhes pas a'i'i rkyen no //

original: si la nu'o //
analyzed: si la nu'o //
translated: si la nu

analyzed: aa na dv'a ha zhes pa 'di'i si pha rol la nu a'a ga mar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this anandāhi, the nu becomes āga on the other side of si.

original: aa na dv'a na /
analyzed: aa na dv'a na /
translated: anandānau

original: si la zhes pa ni zhe na /
analyzed: si la zhes pa ni zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is si la,

original: aa na dv'a ha\:/🔽sam buddhi la gnyis dag gi thung ngu'o //
analyzed: aa na dv'a ha\:/ sam buddhi la gnyis dag gi thung ngu'o //
translated: anandāhi🔽sambudi la gnyis dag gi thung ngu’o.

original: gnyis dag gi ste /
analyzed: gnyis dag gi ste /
translated: Of the two

original: tsa tvar dang aa na dv'a ha gnyis dag gi ni sambuddhi pha rol thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsa tvar dang aa na dv'a ha gnyis dag gi ni sambuddhi pha rol thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: Of the two, catvāra and anandāhi, sambudi becomes short on the other side.

original: he pri ya tsa tvar ra /
analyzed: he pri ya tsa tvar ra /
translated: he priyā catvāra

original: gang gi dga' bar nams bzhi yin pa de dga' ba bzhi rnams te de'i bod pa la'o //
analyzed: gang gi dga' bar nams bzhi yin pa de dga' ba bzhi rnams te de'i bod pa la'o //
translated: He whose four are priyas, those four priyas, is the vocative.

original: he aa na d'aha\/
analyzed: he aa na d'aha\/
translated: he anandā

original: sam'uddhi la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sam'uddhi la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: samudbhile. What is it?

original: pri ya tsa tv'a roo /🔽aa da sa'i tshig la ma'o //
analyzed: pri ya tsa tv'a roo / aa da sa'i tshig la ma'o //
translated: priyā catvāra🔽In the word ādasi, ma.

original: aa das zhes pa 'di'i tshig la ste /
analyzed: aa das zhes pa 'di'i tshig la ste /
translated: In this word ādasi,

original: tshig gi bya ba byas par gyur pa na da ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba byas par gyur pa na da ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the function of the word is performed, it becomes the vowel a.

original: aa mushmee / aa mushm'at\/
analyzed: aa mushmee / aa mushm'at\/
translated: am uṣme am uṣmat

original: dv'i ma yin pa'i da ma'o zhes pas ma nyid du grub na'ang nges pa'i don du tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: dv'i ma yin pa'i da ma'o zhes pas ma nyid du grub na'ang nges pa'i don du tshig 'di'o //
translated: If it is established as the vowel a by the non-vowel a, then this word has a definitive meaning.

original: des na tshig gi bya ba byas pa na phyis ma nyid do //
analyzed: des na tshig gi bya ba byas pa na phyis ma nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when the function of the word is performed, it is later the vowel a.

original: gal te yang pha rol nyid kyi phyir ma nyid du thob pa de lta na'ang dang po tshig gi bya ba smee la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te yang pha rol nyid kyi phyir ma nyid du thob pa de lta na'ang dang po tshig gi bya ba smee la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
translated: And if it is obtained as the vowel a because of the other, then in that case, the function of the word first operates on uṣma and so on.

original: des na ma nyid dang au nyid do //
analyzed: des na ma nyid dang au nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the vowel a and the vowel u.

original: ci ste / aa dasa\'i mtha'i ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ci'i phyir bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste / aa dasa\'i mtha'i ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ci'i phyir bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it becomes the vowel a by the final a, why is it not to be explained?

original: de ltar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible in that way.

original: tshig smos pa don yod par 'gyur bas dgos pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig smos pa don yod par 'gyur bas dgos pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mention of the word would be meaningless, it would be purposeless.

original: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po la ait dang bcas pa'i 'ang wansa'i wa sgra'i au nyid do //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po la ait dang bcas pa'i 'ang wansa'i wa sgra'i au nyid do //
translated: The vowel u of the first vowel without ghu is also with iṭ of aṅga.

original: ghut ma yin pa ni ghut min pa'o //
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa ni ghut min pa'o //
translated: The non-ghūṭa is the non-ghūṭa.

original: rkyen gang gi dang po dbyangs @103b yin pa de ni dbyangs dang po'o //
analyzed: rkyen gang gi dang po dbyangs @103b yin pa de ni dbyangs dang po'o //
translated: That which has the first vowel as its first condition is the first vowel.

original: de nas las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Then, the holding of the action.

original: ait dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i wa sgra gang yin pa de ait dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ait dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i wa sgra gang yin pa de ait dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The va sound that occurs together with ai is the one with ai.

original: wanse dang wansu zhes pa 'di dag gi wa sgra gang yin pa de'i ni ait dang bcas pa can te /

analyzed: p'a da'i dad\ bsdu ba'i mtha'i 'o //

original: p'a da zhes pa'o //
analyzed: p'a da zhes pa'o //

original: p'a da'i sgra'i aa yig dbyi ba gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: p'a da'i sgra'i aa yig dbyi ba gzung bar bya ste /

original: nye 'jal ba las ha ti sogs bar ba nyid las sogs zhes pa la sogs pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: nye 'jal ba las ha ti sogs bar ba nyid las sogs zhes pa la sogs pas aa yig dbyi'o //

original: p'a da zhes pa 'di'i ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po pha rol la bsdu pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: p'a da zhes pa 'di'i ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po pha rol la bsdu pa'i mtha' ste /

analyzed: gang gi tshe bsdu ba'i mthar gyur pa de'i tshe pad du bsgyur ba 'thob bo // by'a ghra pa da:/ by'a ghra pa d'a /

original: by'a ghra pa de /
analyzed: by'a ghra pa de /

analyzed: gang gi rkang pa stag gi 'dra ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

original: p'a da'i mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: p'a da'i mtha' dbyi'o //

original: shas dang t'a dang nge'o //
analyzed: shas dang t'a dang nge'o //

analyzed: 'dis bad du bsgyur ba'o //

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

analyzed: dvi pa da:/ dvi pa d'a / dvi pa de / dvi pa d'i /

analyzed: rkang pa gnyis dag tu gyur ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: 'dir grangs nges pa dang su sgra dag las kyang pha rol gyi zhes pa'i tshig las aa yig dbyi'o //

analyzed: p'a da las yang na'o @105a * //

analyzed: zhes pas ai'i rkyen no //

analyzed: stag gi rkang pa'i dngos po ni /

analyzed: bee y'a ghra pa dyam\/

analyzed: yana'o // ya wa tshig dang po dag gi zhes pas aee yig a'a ga ma'o //

original: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: by'a ghra p'a doo /
analyzed: by'a ghra p'a doo /

analyzed: hasti p'a d'an\/ gang rnams kyi rkang ba glang po'i 'dra ba de rnams ni /

analyzed: hasti p'a d'a:/ d'an\ hasti la sogs pa bor ba nyid la zhes pa'i dgag pa las aa yig dbyi ba med do //

analyzed: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las aa na'i aa dbyi ba dang snga ma'i cho ga la ma phyis pa bzhin'ang ngo //

analyzed: wa dang ma ni wa ma dag go //

analyzed: wa ma dag las brtsegs pa ma yin pa ni wa ma brtsegs pa min pa'o //

analyzed: aa na'i aa dbyi ba ni aa dbyi ba'o // phyis pa ma yin pa ni ma phyis pa'o //

original: snga ma'i cho ga la ma phyis pa dang 'dra ba ni ma phyis pa bzhin no //🔽aana'i sgra ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po pha rol la aa yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i cho ga la ma phyis pa dang 'dra ba ni ma phyis pa bzhin no // aana'i sgra ghut ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang po pha rol la aa yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word apūrvā is like the word apūrvā.🔽The word anī is a vowel that is not guttural. The letter a is elided in the following.

original: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa la ste /
analyzed: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa la ste /

original: ba ma brtsegs pa pha rol gyi ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba ma brtsegs pa pha rol gyi ni mi 'gyur ro //

original: snga ma'i cho ga la ma phyis pa bzhin 'ang ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i cho ga la ma phyis pa bzhin 'ang ste /

analyzed: snga ma'i yi ge'i cho ga'i bya ba byed pa la ma phyis pa ste aa yig phyis pa ni ma phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //

original: aa yig dbyi ba byas pa la gang snga ma'i bya ba thob pa de ma phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dbya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //

original: r'a dzny'a / radznye /
analyzed: r'a dzny'a / radznye /

original: 'dir tsa sde dang dri sha sogs rnams kyi 'ang ngo zhes pas dza yig gi na yig gsal byed pha rol la ga nyis du thob pa la de ma phyis pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //

translated: Here, the un-aspirated is the one that has the preceding letter's sibilant sound. The aspirated is like the un-aspirated.

original: aakshu / aaknne /
analyzed: aakshu / aaknne /
translated: akṣu, akṣṇe

analyzed: aasthi da dhi shakthi aakshi rnams kyi zhes pas aan du bsgyur ro //

analyzed: d'ir ha shash tsha zhes pas sha yig gi da nyid thob pa la ma phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //

original: dadhna / dadhne /
analyzed: dadhna / dadhne /

analyzed: 'dir yang dha yig gi na yig sgra ldan pha rol la dhuta'i gsum par thob pa la'o //

analyzed: wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: ya dzra na:/ karma na:/

analyzed: aan zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: sa ra d'a /
analyzed: sa ra d'a /

translated: What is the meaning of “in the former rite”?🔽rā jña🔽Here, the na of the other na is the application of the ca of the ta class of the ta class. Thus, it is made into the syllable nya. Later, it does not become a thing like pa.

analyzed: gal te 'gyur na na yig la dza yig gi sbyor ba la dbyangs bsgyur ba ni pha rol can no zhes pas aa ka med par 'gyur zhing /

original: snga ma'i cho ga so sor gnas can dang 'dra'o zhes pa'i tshig las dbyi ba gnas can dang 'dra ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes pas snga ma'i cho ga la ma phiys pa dang 'dra'o zhes pa 'id ni rtag tu shes par bya'o //🔽des na / bhunydzanti /

translated: The word like the one with the individual former rite means that it becomes a thing like the one with the individual former rite. Therefore, it should always be understood that like the one with the former rite uncorrected.

analyzed: si tsanti zhes pa la sogs pa grub po //

translated: . The co-existent is the co-existent, because of the co-existent. The word “realization” is from the affix ṇini. The co-existent ya is the ya of the affix ya.

analyzed: gang ka yig gi rkyen pha rol du gnas pa la snga ma'i aa yig ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro ; / sarbi k'a /

analyzed: bi shvi k'a /

translated: Here, from the words “yuṣmat, asmat,” in the word “ekatva,” “vā” is also connected.

original: gang tshig las pha rol gyi yushmad\ dang aasmad dag dang 'brel pa gnyis pa'i gcig tshig nyid gnas pa de'i grangs ji lta ba bzhin du tva dang m'a zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang tshig las pha rol gyi yushmad\ dang aasmad dag dang 'brel pa gnyis pa'i gcig tshig nyid gnas pa de'i grangs ji lta ba bzhin du tva dang m'a zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: When the second singular ending is connected with yuşmad and asmad, then these are changed to tava and mama respectively.

original: ni'i sgra ni mdo'i dbye ba gsal bar byed pa'o //🔽ru drastva raksha ti /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni mdo'i dbye ba gsal bar byed pa'o // ru drastva raksha ti /

original: ru dro ma raksha ti /🔽ru dra tva ma raksh ti /🔽ru @109a * //
analyzed: ru dro ma raksha ti / ru dra tva ma raksh ti / ru @109a * //
translated: Rudro-ma-rakṣati🔽Rudra-tva-ma-rakṣati

original: dro ma raksha ti /
analyzed: dro ma raksha ti /
translated: Rudro-ma-rakṣati

original: rkang pa'i dang po dag la ma yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa'i dang po dag la ma yin no //

original: rkang pa'i dang po ni rkang pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i dang po ni rkang pa dang po'o //

analyzed: tshig las yushmad\ aasmad dag gi rkang pa'i dang po ste /

original: shlo ka'i dang podag la gnas par gyur pa na grangs ji lta ba bzhin du bsra dang nas sogs su bsgyur bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽bh'u y'a ta au ma pa ti ra so //
analyzed: shlo ka'i dang podag la gnas par gyur pa na grangs ji lta ba bzhin du bsra dang nas sogs su bsgyur bar mi 'gyur ro // bh'u y'a ta au ma pa ti ra so //
translated: when it occurs at the beginning of a verse, it is not changed to bhra and so on respectively.🔽Bhūyā-t-au-mapa-ti-ra-so

original: yushma kam ba ra da: sa d'a /
analyzed: yushma kam ba ra da: sa d'a /

analyzed: w'a lendu se kha ra: shr'i m'a na sm'a ka ma ri s'u da na:/

analyzed: pra na m'a bi bh'u da bam /

analyzed: sa da nri shu / aa to n'a tha bha y'arta sya ma m'a nu gra ha do bha ba:/

analyzed: bhaktva n'am sha ra n'a tham tva sa d'a bh'u wa te dza n'a:/

analyzed: bi la banta ma to di n'am mam sambuddhar bandhat dat / rkang ba'i dang po dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: ha ra sya bi ma ra m'a b'a n'a / b'antu bo bi ta ta tv'i sha:/

original: ye bhyastri su ri na po sh'a dvi bhya tya pi d'a na wa /🔽tshig las pha rol gyi bod pa'i tshig la was\ dang nas sogs mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ye bhyastri su ri na po sh'a dvi bhya tya pi d'a na wa / tshig las pha rol gyi bod pa'i tshig la was\ dang nas sogs mi 'dod de /
translated: the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,🔽the giver of all to all,

original: de ba datta yushm'a kam gra ma:/
analyzed: de ba datta yushm'a kam gra ma:/
translated: the giver of all to all

original: de ba datta aasm'a kam gr'a ma:/
analyzed: de ba datta aasm'a kam gr'a ma:/
translated: Devadatta, Asama, Grama,

original: tsa sogs sbyor ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: tsa sogs sbyor ba la yang ngo //
translated: and so on, in the compound.

original: gang rnams kyi dang po tsa yig yin pa de rnams ni tsa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi dang po tsa yig yin pa de rnams ni tsa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those which have the letter Ca as the first, they are Ca and so on.

original: de dag sbyor ba ni tsa sogs sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag sbyor ba ni tsa sogs sbyor ba'o //
translated: Their compound is the compound of Ca and so on.

original: tshig las pha rol gyi yushmad\ aasmad dag ni tsa la sogs pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i 'brel bar gyur pa na tshig la was\ dang nas\ sogs su bsgyur bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽gr'a mo yushma kam tsa /
analyzed: tshig las pha rol gyi yushmad\ aasmad dag ni tsa la sogs pa rnams kyi sbyor ba'i 'brel bar gyur pa na tshig la was\ dang nas\ sogs su bsgyur bar mi 'gyur ro // gr'a mo yushma kam tsa /
translated: When the words Asama and Grama become the connection in the compound of Ca and so on, the words Va and Na are not changed to Va and Sa and so on.🔽Gramo yushman ca.

original: gr'a mo aasma kam tsa /🔽gr'a mo yushma bhy'am wa d'i ya te /🔽gr'a mo aasma bhya w'a d'i ya te /
analyzed: gr'a mo aasma kam tsa / gr'a mo yushma bhy'am wa d'i ya te / gr'a mo aasma bhya w'a d'i ya te /
translated: Gramo asmakam ca.🔽Gramo yushman vādīyate.🔽Gramo asmabhyam vādīyate.

original: gr'a mo aasma bhy'am w'a d'i ya te /🔽shi sho yushmam tsa raksha ti /
analyzed: gr'a mo aasma bhy'am w'a d'i ya te / shi sho yushmam tsa raksha ti /
translated: Gramo asmabhyam vādīyate.🔽Śiṣyo yushman ca rakṣati.

original: shi bo aasmanytsa raksha ti /
analyzed: shi bo aasmanytsa raksha ti /
translated: Śiṣyo asman rakṣati.

original: gr'a mo yu wa yoshtsa ti /🔽gr'a mo yu wa yushma svam /
analyzed: gr'a mo yu wa yoshtsa ti / gr'a mo yu wa yushma svam /
translated: Gramo yuvayoś ca tith.🔽Gramo yushman svam.

original: gr'a ma aa w'a yoshtsa svam /🔽gr'a mo yu b'a bhy'am ma tsa da yi te /
analyzed: gr'a ma aa w'a yoshtsa svam /🔽gr'a mo yu b'a bhy'am ma tsa da yi te /
translated: Gramo 'vayoś ca svam.🔽Gramo yuvābhyām mac ca dīyate.

original: gr'a ma a'a w'a bhy'am tsa d'i ya te /🔽shi wo yu w'a tsa raksha ti /
analyzed: gr'a ma a'a w'a bhy'am tsa d'i ya te / shi wo yu w'a tsa raksha ti /
translated: Grama avabhyam ca dayate.🔽Shivoyuvā rakṣati.

original: shi wa a'a w'am tsa raksha ti /🔽gr'a masta wa wa svam /
analyzed: shi wa a'a w'am tsa raksha ti / gr'a masta wa wa svam /
translated: Shivāvām ca rakṣati.🔽Gramastava vayam.

original: gr'a mo ma ba svam /
analyzed: gr'a mo ma ba svam /
translated: Gramo mama vayam.

original: gr'a mastu bhyam w'a d'i ya te /
analyzed: gr'a mastu bhyam w'a d'i ya te /
translated: Gramastuvā vadi yate.

original: gr'a mo ma hyam b'a di ya te /
analyzed: gr'a mo ma hyam b'a di ya te /
translated: Gramo mahāṃ vādīyate.

original: ru drastva me wa raksha ti /
analyzed: ru drastva me wa raksha ti /
translated: Rudras tvaṃ me rakṣati.

original: ru dro m'a me baraksha ti /
analyzed: ru dro m'a me baraksha ti /
translated: Rudro māṃ rakṣati.

original: tsa dang wa dang h'a dang aa hi dang ae ba zhes pa tsa sogs te /
analyzed: tsa dang wa dang h'a dang aa hi dang ae ba zhes pa tsa sogs te /
translated: The words ca, va, ha, atha, eva, etc., are ca, etc.

original: 'di rnams kho nas sbyor ba la dgag pa 'di bshad par bya'i gzhan las ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kho nas sbyor ba la dgag pa 'di bshad par bya'i gzhan las ma yin no //
translated: The prohibition is explained only with regard to these, not with regard to others.

original: lta ba'i don gyi byings rnams kyi sbyor ba las was\ dang nas sogs @109b su mi 'dod de /
analyzed: lta ba'i don gyi byings rnams kyi sbyor ba las was\ dang nas sogs @109b su mi 'dod de /
translated: The suffix va is not accepted in the application of the roots of the meaning of seeing,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i don la'o //🔽gr'a mo yushma n'i ksha te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i don la'o // gr'a mo yushma n'i ksha te /
translated: as in the meaning of not being eye consciousness.🔽Gramo yushmanīkṣate.

original: gr'a mo aasm'a n'i ksha te /
analyzed: gr'a mo aasm'a n'i ksha te /
translated: Gramo asmanīkṣate.

original: yang dag par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par lta bar byed do //
translated: One sees correctly.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not being eye consciousness?

original: rusdra stvam pa shya ni /
analyzed: rusdra stvam pa shya ni /
translated: Rudras tvaṃ paśyānī.

original: ru dro m'am pa shya ti mig rnams kyi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ru dro m'am pa shya ti mig rnams kyi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the eye-consciousness of the Rudra or Pashati sees.

original: 'di rnams kyi rnam dbye la mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rnam dbye la mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: The end of these is divided.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad dang tvad dang mad\ 'di rnams kyi mtha' rnams dbye pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad dang tvad dang mad\ 'di rnams kyi mtha' rnams dbye pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The end of these, yuşmād, asmad, tad, and mad, is divided for the other side.

original: yushma bhyam / aasma bhyam /
analyzed: yushma bhyam / aasma bhyam /
translated: Yuşmābhyām, asmabhyām,

original: bhyas ni aa bhyam'o zhes pas aa bhyam tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bhyas ni aa bhyam'o zhes pas aa bhyam tu 'gyur ro //
translated: bhyas is abhyām.

original: yushm'a su / aasm'a su /
analyzed: yushm'a su / aasm'a su /
translated: Yuşmāsu, asmasu,

original: gsal byed dang po la /
analyzed: gsal byed dang po la /
translated: The first consonant

original: a'a nyid do zhes pas a'a nyid do //
analyzed: a'a nyid do zhes pas a'a nyid do //
translated: is ā itself.

original: tvat / mat\/ gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aato zhes pas aato'o //
analyzed: tvat / mat\/ gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aato zhes pas aato'o //
translated: Tad, not a double, is the fifth. Ato is at.

original: rnam dbye'i skabs su rnam dbye smos pa ni rnam dbye dngos la dbyi ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye'i skabs su rnam dbye smos pa ni rnam dbye dngos la dbyi ba'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of the case endings in the section on the cases is for the purpose of dividing the case endings themselves.

original: des na rnam dbye gang la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de la dbyi bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽khyod kyi bu ni /
analyzed: des na rnam dbye gang la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de la dbyi bar mi 'gyur ro // khyod kyi bu ni /
translated: Therefore, the case ending for which the characteristic of a case is not present will not be divided.🔽Your son🔽is yuşmatputraḥ.

original: yushmatpu tra:/ de bzhin du /
analyzed: yushmatpu tra:/ de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: aasmatpu tra:/ yi ge'i mtha'i sgrub pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las mtha' gzung ba thob pa la slar yang mtha' smos pa ni rnam par gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: aasmatpu tra:/ yi ge'i mtha'i sgrub pa'o zhes pa'i tshig las mtha' gzung ba thob pa la slar yang mtha' smos pa ni rnam par gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word “at the end of a compound” is understood from the word “at the end” in the expression “at the end of a compound.” The repetition of “at the end” is for the purpose of clarification.

original: yuw\ aaw'a dag gnyis brjod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yuw\ aaw'a dag gnyis brjod pa rnams la'o //
translated: yuva and āva are used for the two.

original: gnyis dag gi don rnams brjod do zhes ngag byas pa la bu'i wa tsi'i zhes pas wa tsi ru bsgyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis dag gi don rnams brjod do zhes ngag byas pa la bu'i wa tsi'i zhes pas wa tsi ru bsgyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the two is expressed. Having made this statement, the word āva is changed to āva by the word āva.

original: gdon mi za ba dang bu lon len pa dag la zhes pas ni ni'i rkyen no //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba dang bu lon len pa dag la zhes pas ni ni'i rkyen no //
translated: The instrumental case is used for “indebtedness” and “debt.”

original: rnam dbye la zhes pa 'jug cing yushmad dag gi zhes pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: rnam dbye la zhes pa 'jug cing yushmad dag gi zhes pa'ang ngo //
translated: The locative case is used for “in the case of” and “in the case of yuva and āva.”

original: yushmad dang aasmad dag ni gnyis brjod pa rnams la te /🔽gang gnyis kyi don gyi tshig so sor rnams la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: yushmad dang aasmad dag ni gnyis brjod pa rnams la te / gang gnyis kyi don gyi tshig so sor rnams la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Yuva and āva are used for the two.🔽The words yuva and āva are used for the two in the sense of “in the case of” and “in the case of yuva and āva.”🔽The words yuva and āva are used in the sense of the two, individually, in the case of the number.

original: yu wa dang a'a wa zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur te rnam dbye pha rol la'o //🔽yu w'am / a'a w'm /
analyzed: yu wa dang a'a wa zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur te rnam dbye pha rol la'o // yu w'am / a'a w'm /
translated: The words yuva and āva are used in the sense of the two, individually, in the case of the number.🔽yuvaṃ, āvaṃ

original: yu wa yo:/ a'a wa yo:/
analyzed: yu wa yo:/ a'a wa yo:/
translated: yuvoyam, āvoyam

original: ci ste gnyis brjod pa rnams la zhes pa ci'i phyir klog par mi byed /
analyzed: ci ste gnyis brjod pa rnams la zhes pa ci'i phyir klog par mi byed /
translated: Why not read “in the case of the two expressions”?

original: de ltar yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not possible either.🔽For you, the past is

original: khyed dag 'das pa ni yin pa ni /🔽aa ti yu w'a bhi:/
analyzed: khyed dag 'das pa ni yin pa ni / aa ti yu w'a bhi:/
translated: atītayuvaḥ,

original: aa ti aa w'a bhi:/
analyzed: aa ti aa w'a bhi:/
translated: atītaāvaḥ.

original: 'dir yu wa dang a'a wa dag tu mi 'gyur bas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yu wa dang a'a wa dag tu mi 'gyur bas so zhe na /
translated: Here, yuvaḥ and āvaḥ are not formed.

original: 'dir smras pa yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag ni gnyis brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag ni gnyis brjod pa nyid de /
translated: Here we say: The past is expressed by the two expressions yuṣmat and asmāt.

original: rnam dbye ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir yushmad\ aasmad\ dag gnyis brjod pa @110a * //
analyzed: rnam dbye ni ma yin no // de'i phyir yushmad\ aasmad\ dag gnyis brjod pa @110a * //
translated: It is not a case ending.

original: nyid du gyur pa thams cad du yu wa dang aa wa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid du gyur pa thams cad du yu wa dang aa wa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in all cases where the two expressions yuṣmat and asmāt are used, yuvaḥ and āvaḥ are formed.🔽This is except for the following changes:🔽atītayuvaḥ,

original: tvam\ aa ham\ dang / yu yam dang wa yam dang / tu bhyam dang ma hya ma dang / ta wa dang ma ma zhes pa'i bsgyur ba 'di rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tvam\ aa ham\ dang / yu yam dang wa yam dang / tu bhyam dang ma hya ma dang / ta wa dang ma ma zhes pa'i bsgyur ba 'di rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: atītaāvaḥ.

original: des na khyed dag 'das pa ni /
analyzed: des na khyed dag 'das pa ni /
translated: For you, the past is🔽atītayuvaḥ,

original: aa ti tvam\/ aa tya ham\/
analyzed: aa ti tvam\/ aa tya ham\/
translated: atītaāvaḥ.

original: khyed dag 'das pa ni /🔽aa ti y'u yam /
analyzed: khyed dag 'das pa ni / aa ti y'u yam /
translated: For you, the past is🔽atītayuvaḥ,

original: aa ti wa yam /
analyzed: aa ti wa yam /
translated: atītaāvaḥ.

original: nged dag 'das pa'i ched du bya ba ni /
analyzed: nged dag 'das pa'i ched du bya ba ni /
translated: For us, the past tense is

original: aa ti tu bhyam /
analyzed: aa ti tu bhyam /
translated: atitabhvam

original: aa ti ma hyam\/
analyzed: aa ti ma hyam\/
translated: atitamahvam.

original: khyed dag 'das pa'i ni /
analyzed: khyed dag 'das pa'i ni /
translated: For you, the past tense is

original: aa ti ta wa /
analyzed: aa ti ta wa /
translated: atitavām

original: aa ti ma ma /
analyzed: aa ti ma ma /
translated: atitamam.

original: aam\ dang aoo'ang a'a ma\'o //
analyzed: aam\ dang aoo'ang a'a ma\'o //
translated: am and oṃ are also am and o.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi aam dang aoo zhes pa 'di dag kyang aam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi aam dang aoo zhes pa 'di dag kyang aam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From yūṣman and asmān, the far side am and oṃ are also changed to am.

original: tvam\/ m'am\/ yu wam /
analyzed: tvam\/ m'am\/ yu wam /
translated: tavam, mama, yuvām,🔽āvāṃ.

original: a'a w'am / yushmad\ dang aasmad\ 'o na lhan cig spyod pa ni lhan cig spyod pa dag gi zhes pa'i tshig las gnyis pa'i gnyis tshig aoo yig kho na'i 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽bden te / khyab pa'i rigs pa las thams cad kyi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'a w'am / yushmad\ dang aasmad\ 'o na lhan cig spyod pa ni lhan cig spyod pa dag gi zhes pa'i tshig las gnyis pa'i gnyis tshig aoo yig kho na'i 'gyur ro zhe na / bden te / khyab pa'i rigs pa las thams cad kyi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that the dual of the second person is only oṃ from the statement “the companion is of the companions,”

original: sh sa'i a'ana\'o //
analyzed: sh sa'i a'ana\'o //
translated: it is true, but from the general rule, it is the change of all.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi shas\ ni aan du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽yushm'anbra hma ne na /
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi shas\ ni aan du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // yushm'anbra hma ne na /
translated: The śas of yūṣman and asmān are changed to an.🔽yūṣmanbhrātaraḥ

original: aasmanbra hma ne na /
analyzed: aasmanbra hma ne na /
translated: asmānbhrātaraḥ.

original: shas\ la ste sa'i'ang na'o zhes pa 'dis grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shas\ la ste sa'i'ang na'o zhes pa 'dis grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: And in the case of the locative, isn't this established by the rule saś ca?

original: aushm'a na ku la ni zhes pa 'dir rdzas\ shas\ dag gi zhes pa shi'i dngos par 'gyur ba las so //
analyzed: aushm'a na ku la ni zhes pa 'dir rdzas\ shas\ dag gi zhes pa shi'i dngos par 'gyur ba las so //
translated: Here, in the case of uṣman and kula, the locative is formed from the nominal stem by adding the suffix śa.

original: si la rnam dbye dang bcas pa dag gi tvam\ ham'o //
analyzed: si la rnam dbye dang bcas pa dag gi tvam\ ham'o //
translated: In the case of the locative and the instrumental, the forms are taṃ haṃ and maṃ haṃ.

original: rnam dbye dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i yushmad aasmad\ dag ni rnam dbye dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i yushmad aasmad\ dag ni rnam dbye dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The forms uṣman and asman are the locative and instrumental forms that are used together with the case endings.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag ni si pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa tvam\ dang aa ham zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag ni si pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa tvam\ dang aa ham zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The forms uṣman and asman are transformed into taṃ haṃ and maṃ haṃ, respectively, when used with the locative case ending.

original: tvam\ aa ham /🔽rdzas\ la y'u yam wa yama\'o //
analyzed: tvam\ aa ham / rdzas\ la y'u yam wa yama\'o //
translated: Taṃ haṃ, maṃ haṃ.🔽The forms yuvaṃ and vaṃ are used for the locative and instrumental cases of the dual.

original: rnam dbye dang bcas pa zhes pa rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam dbye dang bcas pa zhes pa rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The suffix saś ca is added.

original: mdo phyi ma dag la'ang ngo //
analyzed: mdo phyi ma dag la'ang ngo //
translated: This also applies to the latter part of the verse.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ ni dzas pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas ppa y'u yam dang wa yam zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ ni dzas pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas ppa y'u yam dang wa yam zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The forms uṣman and asman are transformed into yuvaṃ and vaṃ, respectively, when used with the locative case ending.

original: yu yam / wa yam /
analyzed: yu yam / wa yam /
translated: Yuvaṃ, vaṃ.

original: nge la tu bhyam ma hyam\'o yushmad\ dang aasmad ni nge'i rkyen pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa tu bhyam dang ma hyam zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nge la tu bhyam ma hyam\'o yushmad\ dang aasmad ni nge'i rkyen pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa tu bhyam dang ma hyam zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the particle of the second case, the particle of the third case, and the particle of the fourth case, they are changed to tu, mahyam, and asmai, respectively.🔽tu

original: tu bhyam\ ma /🔽mahya ma\/ ngas\ la ta wa ma ma'o //
analyzed: tu bhyam\ ma / mahya ma\/ ngas\ la ta wa ma ma'o //
translated: mahyam

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad dag ni ngas\'i rkyen pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa dag ta wa dang ma ma zhes pa 'di @110b dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad dag ni ngas\'i rkyen pha rol la rnam dbye dang bcas pa dag ta wa dang ma ma zhes pa 'di @110b dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the particle of the fifth case and the particle of the seventh case, they are changed to tava and mama, respectively.🔽tava

original: ta wa / ma ma /
analyzed: ta wa / ma ma /
translated: mama

original: gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aat\'o //
analyzed: gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aat\'o //
translated: The fifth case that is not dual is at.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi lnga pa aat du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las pha rol gyi lnga pa aat du 'gyur te /
translated: From the particle of the fifth case and the particle of the seventh case, the fifth case is at,

original: gnyis nyid ma yin pa ste gnyis nyid kyi yul gang yin pa de dor nas so //
analyzed: gnyis nyid ma yin pa ste gnyis nyid kyi yul gang yin pa de dor nas so //
translated: not dual, that is, excluding the object of the dual.🔽tvat, mat, yuşmat, asmat

original: tvat\/ mat\/ yushmat\/ aasmat\/  gnyis nyid ces pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tvat\/ mat\/ yushmat\/ aasmat\/  gnyis nyid ces pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by dual?

original: yu w'a bhyam /
analyzed: yu w'a bhyam /
translated: yuvābhyām

original: a'a w'a bhy'am lnga pa'o //
analyzed: a'a w'a bhy'am lnga pa'o //
translated: āvabhyām is the fifth case.

original: bhyas\ ni bhyam'o //
analyzed: bhyas\ ni bhyam'o //
translated: bhyas is bhyam.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las phyi ma'i bzhi pa'i mang tshig bhyas ni byam du bsgyur ba 'thob pa //🔽yushma bhyam d'i ya te /
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag las phyi ma'i bzhi pa'i mang tshig bhyas ni byam du bsgyur ba 'thob pa // yushma bhyam d'i ya te /
translated: From yuşmad and asmad, the fourth case plural of the latter is changed to bhyām by the bhyas.🔽yūṣmābhyāṃ dayate

original: aasma bhyam d'i ya te /🔽s'am\'i a'a ka ma'o //
analyzed: aasma bhyam d'i ya te / s'am\'i a'a ka ma'o //
translated: asmabhyāṃ dayate🔽sākam ākam

original: sa dang bcas pa'i a'am\ ni sama'o ;
analyzed: sa dang bcas pa'i a'am\ ni sama'o ;
translated: sākam ākam

original: / der gnas rnam dbye rnams dbyi bar bya'o zhes pas 'dir dbyi bar bya zhes 'os pa'i rkyen nges par bstan pa las bcas pa'i sgra phyis pa'o //
analyzed: / der gnas rnam dbye rnams dbyi bar bya'o zhes pas 'dir dbyi bar bya zhes 'os pa'i rkyen nges par bstan pa las bcas pa'i sgra phyis pa'o //
translated: There, the case endings are to be elided. Thus, the eliding is appropriate here. The word sākam is elided because of the rule that teaches the definite ending of the appropriate condition.

original: yushmad dang aasmad dag las phyi ma'i s'am\ ni a'a kam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yushmad dang aasmad dag las phyi ma'i s'am\ ni a'a kam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From yuşmad and asmad, the sākam of the latter is changed to ākam.🔽yūṣmākām

original: yushm'a kam ma /
analyzed: yushm'a kam ma /
translated: asmakām

original: aasm'a kam\/ 'o na aam\ dang s'am\ 'bral med du spyod pa'i phyir sa yig gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes pas sa yig nye bar blangs pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: aasm'a kam\/ 'o na aam\ dang s'am\ 'bral med du spyod pa'i phyir sa yig gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes pas sa yig nye bar blangs pa don med do zhe na /
translated: Well then, since the letters sa and ām are always used together, it is meaningless to take the letter sa, because it is said that the letter sa is taken.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: a'a kam\ du bsgyur bar byas pa na gang la su yig a'a ga ma thob pa de ldog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: a'a kam\ du bsgyur bar byas pa na gang la su yig a'a ga ma thob pa de ldog pa'i don du'o //
translated: When changed to ākam, the letter su is obtained for the purpose of eliding that which comes after the letter ā.

original: ma bsgyur ba la ae nyid do //🔽gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgyur ba la ae nyid do // gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The particle e is used for the uninflected.🔽The particle ta is used for the locative.

original: gang la bsgyur ba'i gnas yod pa de ni gnas can no //
analyzed: gang la bsgyur ba'i gnas yod pa de ni gnas can no //
translated: The particle tva is used for the one who has the locative.

original: gang bsgyur ba yod pa min pa can zhes pa 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsgyur ba yod pa min pa can zhes pa 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: The particle as is used for the one who does not have the inflected.

original: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag gi mtha' de ni ae nyid du 'gyur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yushmad\ dang aasmad\ dag gi mtha' de ni ae nyid du 'gyur du 'gyur te /
translated: The final of yushmat and asmat becomes e.

original: ma bsgyur ba ste bsgyur ba'i bya ba med pa'i rnam dbye'i tshig pha rol la'o //
analyzed: ma bsgyur ba ste bsgyur ba'i bya ba med pa'i rnam dbye'i tshig pha rol la'o //
translated: The particle e is used for the uninflected, that is, for the case ending that does not have the action of being inflected.🔽Tva, ma,

original: tva y'a ; ma y'a /🔽yu wa yo:/ a'a wa yo:/
analyzed: tva y'a ; ma y'a / yu wa yo:/ a'a wa yo:/
translated: yuva, āva,

original: tva yi / ma yi /
analyzed: tva yi / ma yi /
translated: tva, ma,

original: ma bsgyur ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma bsgyur ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the uninflected?

original: tvatra / ma ta /
analyzed: tvatra / ma ta /
translated: Tat, mat,

original: yushmat / aasmat\/ gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aata'o zhes pa'i nga si dang bhyas ngag aat tu bsgyur ro //
analyzed: yushmat / aasmat\/ gnyis nyid ma yin pa'i lnga pa ni aata'o zhes pa'i nga si dang bhyas ngag aat tu bsgyur ro //
translated: yushmat, asmat. The fifth case ending that is not dual is at. The particle at is changed to attu by the particle as and bhyas.

original: gsal byed dang po la a'a nyid do //
analyzed: gsal byed dang po la a'a nyid do //
translated: The first consonant becomes a.

original: ma bsgyur ba la zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma bsgyur ba la zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: The particle a is used for the uninflected.

original: yushmad dang aasmad\ dag gi mtha' ni a'a nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yushmad dang aasmad\ dag gi mtha' ni a'a nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The final of yushmat and asmat becomes a.

analyzed: gsal byed dang po can gyi ma bsgyur ba'i rnam dbye'i tshig pha rol la'o //

original: aa nyid 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: aa nyid 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: yu w'a bhyam\/ a'a w'a bhy'am / yushma bhi:/ aasma bhi:/

original: yushm'a su / aasm'a su /
analyzed: yushm'a su / aasm'a su /

analyzed: ma bsgyur ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: yushm'a bhy'am\ @111a * // aasm'a bhya'am / ree'o //

translated: Maghavantyam,

original: phyogs gcig la /🔽ma gha w'a /🔽ma gha w'a noo /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la / ma gha w'a / ma gha w'a noo /
translated: in one place,🔽Maghavan,🔽Maghavanno,

original: ma gha wan:/ ma gho na:/
analyzed: ma gha wan:/ ma gho na:/
translated: Maghavan, Magho na,

original: ma gho na: brgya byin gyi 'di /
analyzed: ma gho na: brgya byin gyi 'di /
translated: Magho na, this of Indra,

original: m'a gha wa nam\/🔽dza ra dbyangs la dza ras yang na'o //
analyzed: m'a gha wa nam\/ dza ra dbyangs la dza ras yang na'o //
translated: Maghavan,🔽the vowel Ja is changed to Ja by the addition of Ra.

original: dza ra'i sga ni dbyangs pha rol la dza ras su bsgyur bar yang na 'thob po //🔽dza ra s'a /🔽dza ra ya /
analyzed: dza ra'i sga ni dbyangs pha rol la dza ras su bsgyur bar yang na 'thob po // dza ra s'a / dza ra ya /
translated: The word Jagara is changed to Jagari by the addition of the vowel Ri.🔽Jagaras, Jagari,

original: dza ras / dza r'a ye /
analyzed: dza ras / dza r'a ye /
translated: Jagari,

original: rga ba las 'das pa'i rigs rnams ni /
analyzed: rga ba las 'das pa'i rigs rnams ni /
translated: the families that are beyond old age,

original: aa ti dza ram si /
analyzed: aa ti dza ram si /
translated: Atijarama si,

original: dhut dang dbyangs las ghu ta la nu'o //
analyzed: dhut dang dbyangs las ghu ta la nu'o //
translated: Dhrita and the vowel U are changed to Ghrita.

original: sa mtha' dang mahanta dag gi zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: sa mtha' dang mahanta dag gi zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long ones are those of the end of the section and the mahendra.

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one case,

original: aa ti dza r'a ni /
analyzed: aa ti dza r'a ni /
translated: atijarāṇi.

original: dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na ;
analyzed: dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na ;
translated: What is the feminine?

original: dza r'a bhyam /
analyzed: dza r'a bhyam /
translated: jarābhyām,🔽jarābhiḥ.

original: dza r'a bhi:/ ti\ tsa tv'a ra dag gi bud med la ti sri tsa ta sri dag rnam dbye la'o //
analyzed: dza r'a bhi:/ ti\ tsa tv'a ra dag gi bud med la ti sri tsa ta sri dag rnam dbye la'o //
translated: The feminine of ti and catvāra is tisri and catasri, respectively.

original: yang na zhes ldog cing la cing pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: yang na zhes ldog cing la cing pa'ang ngo //
translated: Or, the feminine is also like that.

original: tri dang tsa tv'ar zhes pa 'di dag bud med la 'jug bzhin pa na rnams dbye pha rol grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ti sri dang tsa ta sri zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽ti sra:/ tsa ta sra:/
analyzed: tri dang tsa tv'ar zhes pa 'di dag bud med la 'jug bzhin pa na rnams dbye pha rol grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ti sri dang tsa ta sri zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // ti sra:/ tsa ta sra:/
translated: When these ti and catvāra are used in the feminine, they become tisri and catasri, respectively.🔽tisri,🔽catasri.🔽tisribhiḥ,

original: ti sri bhi:/ tsa ta sri bhi:/
analyzed: ti sri bhi:/ tsa ta sri bhi:/
translated: catasribhiḥ.

original: ti sri shu /
analyzed: ti sri shu /
translated: tisṛbhyaḥ,

original: bud med la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bud med la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the feminine?🔽tayā,

original: ta\ ya:/ tsa tv'a ra:/🔽tri ni / tsa tv'a ri /
analyzed: ta\ ya:/ tsa tv'a ra:/ tri ni / tsa tv'a ri /
translated: catasṛbhiḥ.

original: rnam dbye la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam dbye la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the case?

original: gsum rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni tri t'i ya /
analyzed: gsum rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni tri t'i ya /
translated: The accusative of three is tisṛbhiḥ.

original: bzhi pa rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnams kyi rdzogs pa ni /
translated: The accusative of four is catasṛbhiḥ.

original: tsa turth'i / ra sha dag gi mtha' la da tha'o zhes pas tsa tur\ la tha yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: tsa turth'i / ra sha dag gi mtha' la da tha'o zhes pas tsa tur\ la tha yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The final of catuḥ and raśmi is tha.

original: na da sogs nyid las a'i yig go //
analyzed: na da sogs nyid las a'i yig go //
translated: The final of nada and so on is a.

original: de dag dbyangs la ra'o //
analyzed: de dag dbyangs la ra'o //
translated: Those are the vowels.

original: de dag ste ti sri dang tsa ta sri'i sgra dag gi dbyangs pha rol la ra nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ste ti sri dang tsa ta sri'i sgra dag gi dbyangs pha rol la ra nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those, namely the sounds tiṣṭhati and catasro, become ra itself after the vowel.

original: ngi dang ghut dag las aar du bsgyur ba thob pa dang / shas la aagni bzhin du bsgyur ba thob pa dang / nga si ngas\ dag gi rit\ mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pas au yig tu bsgyur ba thob pas de rnams 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: ngi dang ghut dag las aar du bsgyur ba thob pa dang / shas la aagni bzhin du bsgyur ba thob pa dang / nga si ngas\ dag gi rit\ mtha' las snga ma dang bcas pa'o zhes pas au yig tu bsgyur ba thob pas de rnams 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The change of ṅi and ghu to ar is obtained, the change of śa to agni is obtained, and the change of ṅsa and ṅsi to ṛt is obtained by adding the first, thus the letter u is obtained.

original: ti prastishthanti / tsa ta srastishthanti /
analyzed: ti prastishthanti / tsa ta srastishthanti /
translated: Tiṣṭhati, catasro tiṣṭhati.

original: ti sra:/ pa shya /
analyzed: ti sra:/ pa shya /
translated: Tiṣṭha, paśya.

original: tsa ta sra:/ pa shya /
analyzed: tsa ta sra:/ pa shya /
translated: Catasro paśya.

original: bram ze gang dag gi dga' ba gsum yin pa de dag dga' ba gsum pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze gang dag gi dga' ba gsum yin pa de dag dga' ba gsum pa ste /
translated: Those brahmins who have three delights are tripriyāḥ.

original: de las ni /
analyzed: de las ni /
translated: From that,

original: pri ya ti pra a'a ga ta:/
analyzed: pri ya ti pra a'a ga ta:/
translated: priyatir āgatā.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: bri ya tsa ta pra a'a ga ta:/
analyzed: bri ya tsa ta pra a'a ga ta:/
translated: tripriyāc catasro āgatāḥ.

original: pri ya ti sra: svam\/🔽pri ya tsa ta sra: svam\/🔽pri ya ti sri /
analyzed: pri ya ti sra: svam\/ pri ya tsa ta sra: svam\/ pri ya ti sri /
translated: priyāti srām🔽priyacat srām🔽priyāti sri

original: pri ya tsa ta sri /
analyzed: pri ya tsa ta sri /
translated: priyacat sri

original: dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the long vowel?

original: ti sri bhi:/ tsa ta sri bhi:/
analyzed: ti sri bhi:/ tsa ta sri bhi:/
translated: tisribhiḥ, catasribhiḥ.

original: n'am la ring po ma yin no //
analyzed: n'am la ring po ma yin no //
translated: The long vowel is not in the nā.

original: na dang ldan pa'i @112a * //
analyzed: na dang ldan pa'i @112a * //
translated: The nā is endowed with the aṃ.

original: a'am\ ni n'am\'o //
analyzed: a'am\ ni n'am\'o //
translated: The aṃ is the nā.🔽The long vowel is not in the nā, from that, in the words tisri and catasri.

original: n'am\ de las te ti sri dang tsa sri'i sgra dag gi ni na yig a'a ga ma dang ldan pa'i a'am\ pha rol la ring por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: n'am\ de las te ti sri dang tsa sri'i sgra dag gi ni na yig a'a ga ma dang ldan pa'i a'am\ pha rol la ring por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The long vowel is in the aṃ which is endowed with the following a.

original: nu dang bcas pa'i a'am\ la ring po'o zhes pas thob pa la'o //🔽ti sri n'am /
analyzed: nu dang bcas pa'i a'am\ la ring po'o zhes pas thob pa la'o // ti sri n'am /
translated: The long vowel is in the aṃ which is endowed with the nu.🔽tisriṇām

original: tsa ta sri n'am\/
analyzed: tsa ta sri n'am\/
translated: catasriṇām

original: nri'i yang na'o //
analyzed: nri'i yang na'o //
translated: The nā is also of nṛ.

original: nri'i sgra ni a'am pha rol la ring por yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nri'i sgra ni a'am pha rol la ring por yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: The word nṛ has a long vowel in the aṃ which is the following.🔽nṛṇām

original: nr'i n'a / ni n'am\/
analyzed: nr'i n'a / ni n'am\/
translated: Nari na!🔽Ninam!🔽

original: tyad stogs rnams kyi rnam dbye la aa'o //
analyzed: tyad stogs rnams kyi rnam dbye la aa'o //
translated: The a is in the divisions of the optative.

original: tyad dang tad dang yang dag ae tad dang aa das dang ai dam dang dvi ste 'di rnam tad sogs rnams te /
analyzed: tyad dang tad dang yang dag ae tad dang aa das dang ai dam dang dvi ste 'di rnam tad sogs rnams te /
translated: The optative, the perfect, the future, the optative of obligation, the optative of request, and the optative of permission, these are the optatives and so forth.

original: 'di rnams kyi mtha' rnam dbye pha rol la aa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mtha' rnam dbye pha rol la aa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The final of these is changed to the letter a in the case of the other case endings.🔽syah🔽sah🔽yah🔽eṣah

original: sya:/ sa:/ ya:/ aesha:/  tyad sogs rnams kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sya:/ sa:/ ya:/ aesha:/  tyad sogs rnams kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: tyādīnām iti kim?🔽bhavanti

original: bha w'an\/ bha wantoo /
analyzed: bha w'an\/ bha wantoo /
translated: bhavanto🔽bhavantīti

original: bha wanta:/ slar yang rnam dbye smos pa ni rnam dbye dngos las tyad sogs kyi aa nyid kyi don du'o //
analyzed: bha wanta:/ slar yang rnam dbye smos pa ni rnam dbye dngos las tyad sogs kyi aa nyid kyi don du'o //
translated: The mention of the case endings again is for the sake of the a of tyādīni in the actual case endings.

original: de nas rnam dbye gang la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yod pa de la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam dbye gang la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yod pa de la mi 'gyur te /
translated: Then, in which case ending the characteristic of the conditional is, there is no change.

original: de'i bu ni /
analyzed: de'i bu ni /
translated: His son is🔽tatsūnuḥ

original: tat+su tra:/ tad sogs rnams kyi'ang rnam dbye dngos la 'dod do //
analyzed: tat+su tra:/ tad sogs rnams kyi'ang rnam dbye dngos la 'dod do //
translated: tyādīnām api kārakāṇi iṣyante.🔽kimkau

original: kim ka'o // ki ma'i sgra ni rnam dbye pha rol la ka yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kim ka'o // ki ma'i sgra ni rnam dbye pha rol la ka yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word kim is changed to the letter ka in the case of the other case endings.🔽kaḥ🔽kau🔽ke

original: ka:/ koo:/ ke / ken /
analyzed: ka:/ koo:/ ke / ken /
translated: kasya

original: kasyee / dvi ma yin pa'i da ma'o //
analyzed: kasyee / dvi ma yin pa'i da ma'o //
translated: The da of non-dual is

original: tyad sogs rnams kyi da yig ni rnam dbye pha rol la na nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tyad sogs rnams kyi da yig ni rnam dbye pha rol la na nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: tyādīnām iti daḥ kārakāṇi iṣyante.

original: dvi ma yin pa ste dv'i da yig nyid ma gtogs so //🔽ai moo / ai me /
analyzed: dvi ma yin pa ste dv'i da yig nyid ma gtogs so // ai moo / ai me /
translated: Non-dual, except for the da of dvau.🔽imām

original: ai mam / ai m'an\/
analyzed: ai mam / ai m'an\/
translated: ime

original: dvi ma yin pa'i zhes pa ce zhe na /
analyzed: dvi ma yin pa'i zhes pa ce zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “not dual”?🔽Dva, dvau,

original: dvoo / dv'a bhyam\/🔽si la sa'o //
analyzed: dvoo / dv'a bhyam\/ si la sa'o //
translated: dvau.

original: tyad sogs rnams kyi da yig ni si pha rol las yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tyad sogs rnams kyi da yig ni si pha rol las yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllable da of tyad etc. is changed to ya after si.

original: aa soo / ta'i'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa soo / ta'i'ang ngo //
translated: Asau, tya.

original: tyad sogs rnams kyi ta yig ni si pha rol la sa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tyad sogs rnams kyi ta yig ni si pha rol la sa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllable ta of tyad etc. is changed to sa after si.

original: sya:/ sa:/ aesha:/ yid dam\ ai yam\ ste skyes pa la aa ma ya'o //
analyzed: sya:/ sa:/ aesha:/ yid dam\ ai yam\ ste skyes pa la aa ma ya'o //
translated: Syah, saḥ, eṣaḥ, manas, iyaṃ, and in the masculine, amā.

original: si la zhes pa kho na'o //🔽tvi tsa tvar dag gi bud med la zhes pa'i mdo de'i bud med la zhes pa 'jug go /
analyzed: si la zhes pa kho na'o // tvi tsa tvar dag gi bud med la zhes pa'i mdo de'i bud med la zhes pa 'jug go /
translated: Si is just that.🔽In the sūtra “in the case of women in the four [vowels] a, ā, i, and u,” the word “women” is supplied.

original: ai dam gyi sgra ni bud med kyi yul la si pha rol la ai yam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ai dam gyi sgra ni bud med kyi yul la si pha rol la ai yam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word idam is changed to iyaṃ after si in the feminine.

original: ai dam gyi sgra skyes pa'i yul la ni si pha rol la aa yam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽aa ymam goo r'i:/
analyzed: ai dam gyi sgra skyes pa'i yul la ni si pha rol la aa yam du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // aa ymam goo r'i:/
translated: The word idam is changed to ayam after si in the masculine.🔽Ayam goḥ.

original: aa yam ru tra:/
analyzed: aa yam ru tra:/
translated: Ayam rudraḥ.

original: ma ning la ni bsgyur ba med pa'i phyir ai dam zhes pa kho na te /
analyzed: ma ning la ni bsgyur ba med pa'i phyir ai dam zhes pa kho na te /
translated: Since there is no change in the neuter, it is just idam.

original: ai dam\ @112b wa nam\/
analyzed: ai dam\ @112b wa nam\/
translated: Idam vānam.

original: gsal byed las aak med pa'i aata\'o //
analyzed: gsal byed las aak med pa'i aata\'o //
translated: The ak is the at without the ak.

original: ai dam gsal byed la aaka'i rkyen yod pa ma yin pa de ni aak med pa'o //
analyzed: ai dam gsal byed la aaka'i rkyen yod pa ma yin pa de ni aak med pa'o //
translated: The idam is the vowel without the ak.

original: ai dam zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ai dam zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: The idam is just that.

original: aak\ med pa ste aaka\'i rkyen dang bral ba'i ai dam ni rnam dbye gsal byed pha rol la aa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro ;🔽/ aasmee / a'a bhya'm /
analyzed: aak\ med pa ste aaka\'i rkyen dang bral ba'i ai dam ni rnam dbye gsal byed pha rol la aa yig tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro ; / aasmee / a'a bhya'm /
translated: The idam without the ak, that is, without the ak vowel, becomes the letter a when it is followed by a consonant.🔽The asme and the avabhyam.

original: aa bhi:/ ae shu /
analyzed: aa bhi:/ ae shu /
translated: The avabhiḥ and the eṣu.

original: gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽ai moo / rnam dbye'i gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na / ai moo / rnam dbye'i gsal byed la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by consonant?🔽The imom and the idam.

original: ai dam wa'n\/ aak med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ai dam wa'n\/ aak med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by without ak?

original: 'di rnams kyi mi shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mi shes pa ni /
translated: The ignorance of these is as follows.🔽The imake and the idamvāna.

original: ai ma kee:/ de'i dbus su lhung ba ni de smos pas gzung par bya'o zhes pas aak dang bcas pa'i ai dam pa'i 'ang bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ai ma kee:/ de'i dbus su lhung ba ni de smos pas gzung par bya'o zhes pas aak dang bcas pa'i ai dam pa'i 'ang bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The idamvāna is to be taken by mentioning that, which is fallen in the middle of that, so the idam with the ak is also changed to a.

original: t'a aos dag la aa na'o //
analyzed: t'a aos dag la aa na'o //
translated: The tāyo and the dāyo.

original: aak med pa zhes pa rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: aak med pa zhes pa rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The ak is added.

original: si la aoo te si te si dbyi ba zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
analyzed: si la aoo te si te si dbyi ba zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
translated: From this, silā, sito, sito, sito and sito are higher.

original: aaka\'i rkyen dang bral ba'i ai dam\ ni t'a dang aos zhes pa 'di dag pha rol la aa na ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽aa ne na /
analyzed: aaka\'i rkyen dang bral ba'i ai dam\ ni t'a dang aos zhes pa 'di dag pha rol la aa na ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // aa ne na /
translated: When ak is without a condition, idaṃ, idaṃ, idaṃ and idaṃ are changed to anaṃ in the other.🔽Anaṃ, anaṃ, anaṃ and anaṃ are the forms.

original: aa na yo:/ aaka\ med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽ai ma ke na /
analyzed: aa na yo:/ aaka\ med pa zhes pa ci zhe na / ai ma ke na /
translated: What is ak?

original: ai ma ka mo:/
analyzed: ai ma ka mo:/
translated: imaṃ, imaṃ, imaṃ and imaṃ are the forms.🔽What is idaṃ?🔽idaṃ, idaṃ, idaṃ and idaṃ are the forms.

original: ae tad 'i rjes su bstan pa la gnyis pa la yang ae na'o //
analyzed: ae tad 'i rjes su bstan pa la gnyis pa la yang ae na'o //
translated: After etad, there are two, and also anaṃ in the second.

original: ai dam\ dang ae dang ae tada'i 'ang gnyis pa dang t'a aos zhes pa 'di rnams pha rol la ae na ru bsgyur bar bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: ai dam\ dang ae dang ae tada'i 'ang gnyis pa dang t'a aos zhes pa 'di rnams pha rol la ae na ru bsgyur bar bshad par bya ste ;
translated: Also idaṃ, idaṃ, idaṃ and idaṃ are explained to be changed to anaṃ in the other.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i yul la'o //
translated: In the object of instruction,

original: gang du gcig gi dngos po cung zad tsam bsgrub nas slar yang gzhan sgrub pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang du gcig gi dngos po cung zad tsam bsgrub nas slar yang gzhan sgrub pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: where a little of the nature of one is established and then again another is established, that is instruction.🔽Teach this student to read the Veda.

original: slob ma 'di la rig byed klog tu 'jug / aa tho ae nam by'a ka ra na ma sya dya sa ya /
analyzed: slob ma 'di la rig byed klog tu 'jug / aa tho ae nam by'a ka ra na ma sya dya sa ya /
translated: atha enaṃ vyākaraṇam asyāya sāya,

original: ae nam shi shyam ba de ma dhya sa ya /
analyzed: ae nam shi shyam ba de ma dhya sa ya /
translated: enaṃ śiṣyaṃ vadeta madhyāya.

original: aatho ae nam by'a ka ra nam sya dhy'a sa ya /
analyzed: aatho ae nam by'a ka ra nam sya dhy'a sa ya /
translated: Athô enaṃ vyākaraṇasyâdhyāyaḥ.

original: slob ma 'dis tshigs bcad klog / aa tho ae ne na by'a ka ra na ma sya dhi tam\/
analyzed: slob ma 'dis tshigs bcad klog / aa tho ae ne na by'a ka ra na ma sya dhi tam\/
translated: This pupil reads the verse: Athô enaṃ vyākaraṇasyâdhyāyam.

original: de dag gi slob ma ngang tshul bzang po ni /
analyzed: de dag gi slob ma ngang tshul bzang po ni /
translated: Their pupil of good character is:

original: aa tho ae na yo:/
analyzed: aa tho ae na yo:/
translated: Athô enaṃ yoḥ.

original: pra bhu tam sv'am /
analyzed: pra bhu tam sv'am /
translated: Prabhūtaṃ svām.

original: de sa tshigs bcad klog / aa tho ae ne na by'a ka ra nam sya dh'i tam\/
analyzed: de sa tshigs bcad klog / aa tho ae ne na by'a ka ra nam sya dh'i tam\/
translated: He reads the verse: Athô enaṃ vyākaraṇasyâdhyāyam.

original: de dag gi slob ma ngang tshul bzang po ni /
analyzed: de dag gi slob ma ngang tshul bzang po ni /
translated: Their pupil of good character is:

original: aa tho ae na yo pra bh'u tam svam /
analyzed: aa tho ae na yo pra bh'u tam svam /
translated: Athô enaṃ yoḥ prabhūtaṃ svām.

original: de las bhis\ bhing\'o //
analyzed: de las bhis\ bhing\'o //
translated: From that, bhis bhis.

original: de las te aak\ med pa'i ai dam\ las pha rol gyi ni bhir du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las te aak\ med pa'i ai dam\ las pha rol gyi ni bhir du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the ak-less idam becomes changed to the other bhir.

original: ae bhi:/ bhi sa'i bhir\'i tshig ni aees mi 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ae bhi:/ bhi sa'i bhir\'i tshig ni aees mi 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: E bhis. The word bhis is for the purpose of not entering e.

original: aak\ med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aak\ med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the ak-less?

analyzed: parna dhva soo /

analyzed: gang rnams kyi dang po ya dza yin pa de rnams yadza\ sogs so //

original: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //

original: ya dza dang sri dza dang mri dza dang r'a dza dang bhra dza dang brashtsa dang pa ri pra'adza zhes pa 'di rnams kyi 'ang rdzogs pa dang gsal byed dang po rnams la da nyid du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: na dang brtsegs pa'i mtha' dag phyis pa ni ma phyis pa bzhin no //

analyzed: de dag dbyi ba ni na dang brtsegs mtha' dbyi ba'o //

analyzed: na yig dang brtsegs pa'i mtha' dag phyis pa gang yin pa de na phyis pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phyis pa gang la bya ba thob pa de mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //

original: r'a dza bhy'am /
analyzed: r'a dza bhy'am /

analyzed: 'dir na yig phyis pa ni ma phyis pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir aa yig ring po'o zhes pas ring por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the anusvāra is erased, and because it is like the non-erased, it is not lengthened by the long ā, as in rājabhāṃ.

analyzed: r'a dza bhi:/ aees\ su mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ae nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: go m'an\/ su m'an\/

analyzed: brtsegs pa'i mtha' phyis pa ni ma phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir na dbyi ba med do //

original: mtshams sbyor gyi bya ba sha nyid la bya ba la ma phyis pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por gzhan dag 'dod de /🔽sv'a m'i / a'i shvar\/
analyzed: mtshams sbyor gyi bya ba sha nyid la bya ba la ma phyis pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por gzhan dag 'dod de / sv'a m'i / a'i shvar\/
translated: Others assert that the function of the affix is to the very flesh, like something uncooked.🔽[This is] from the expression “svaṃ mī” and “ā īśvaraḥ,”

original: aa dhi pa ti zhes pa dang s'a dhu ka ri rnams la zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so //🔽ais\ dang aus\ dos\ rnams kyi sgra ldan la ra'o //
analyzed: aa dhi pa ti zhes pa dang s'a dhu ka ri rnams la zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las so // ais\ dang aus\ dos\ rnams kyi sgra ldan la ra'o //

analyzed: ais\ dang aus\ dang dos\ zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sgra ldan pha rol la re phar 'gyur ro //

original: sha nyid 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: sha nyid 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The very flesh is blocked.

original: sarbi rbhy'am / dha nurbhy'am /
analyzed: sarbi rbhy'am / dha nurbhy'am /

analyzed: dorbhy'am / sgra ldan la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: sarbi: shu / dha nu: shu / dhut rnams kyi gsum pa'o //

analyzed: dhut rnams kyi sra ldan pha rol la gsum par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The third of the dhut is added to the end.

original: / aagni madbhya'm /
analyzed: / aagni madbhya'm /

original: dzny'a na bhudbhy'am /
analyzed: dzny'a na bhudbhy'am /

analyzed: madzdzati / du ma masdzo gsal ba la'o //

original: warta m'a na'i ti'o //
analyzed: warta m'a na'i ti'o //

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //

original: li tu las rnams kyi sa'o zhes pas yi ge gnas 'dra ba'i phyir sa'i gsum pa da'o //
analyzed: li tu las rnams kyi sa'o zhes pas yi ge gnas 'dra ba'i phyir sa'i gsum pa da'o //
translated: The third syllable is DA, because of the statement, The syllable LI is the place of all actions, since the syllables are similar.

analyzed: ta sde'i tsa ta'i sde pa zhes pas da'i dza'o //
translated: The fourth syllable is DA, because of the statement, The TA class is the CA class, and so on.

original: sgra ldan la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sgra ldan la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: ja gat+su / sgra med pa la dang po'o //
analyzed: ja gat+su / sgra med pa la dang po'o //
translated: The first is for that which is without sound.

original: dhut rnams kyi zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dhut rnams kyi zhes pa kho na'o //

original: dhut rnams kyi sgra med la pha rol la dang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhut rnams kyi sgra med la pha rol la dang por 'gyur ro //

original: aagni mat+su / dzny'a na bhut+su /
analyzed: aagni mat+su / dzny'a na bhut+su /

original: sgra med la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽dzny'a buddhoo / rdzogs pa la yang na'o //
analyzed: sgra med la zhes pa ci zhe na / dzny'a buddhoo / rdzogs pa la yang na'o //

original: dhut rnams kyi rdzogs pa la ste mtha' 'jug bzhin pa la dang por yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhut rnams kyi rdzogs pa la ste mtha' 'jug bzhin pa la dang por yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: The DHUTs is the same as before. The first is for completion, that is, for that which is being completed, as if it were the end.

original: gsum pa smros parjes su 'jug pas @117a * //
