original: nya las zhes ba a'i yig go /
analyzed: nya las zhes ba a'i yig go /
translated: Nya means the letter A.

original: bu rgyud kyi ya'i zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
analyzed: bu rgyud kyi ya'i zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
translated: The letter Ya is combined with the family Ya.

original: dzas so // de bzhin du /
analyzed: dzas so // de bzhin du /
translated: Thus,

original: y'a skya:/ bee rya:/
analyzed: y'a skya:/ bee rya:/
translated: Yaska and Vidya.

original: yaska dang bid dag las aana'o //
analyzed: yaska dang bid dag las aana'o //
translated: From Ya and Vid, An.

original: aan dang ae ya dang ai ka @118b las zhes pas a'i yig go //
analyzed: aan dang ae ya dang ai ka @118b las zhes pas a'i yig go //
translated: An, Eya, and Ika, the letter A.

original: dzas so // bu rgyud kyi rkyen gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dzas so // bu rgyud kyi rkyen gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: Jasa. What is meant by the condition of the family?

original: garga'i slob ma 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: garga'i slob ma 'di rnams ni /
translated: These disciples of Garga are

original: g'arg'a:/ y'ask'a:/ bee d'a:/
analyzed: g'arg'a:/ y'ask'a:/ bee d'a:/
translated: Garga, Yaska, and Vidya.

original: de'i 'di zhes pas aana'o //
analyzed: de'i 'di zhes pas aana'o //
translated: Of that, this means An.

original: garga dang / wansa dang / badzra dang / sam kri ti dang / pr'a m'a ta dang / bya ghra p'a ta dang / aa dza dang bed dang bhu ma zhes sogs rnams ni garga sogs rnams so /
analyzed: garga dang / wansa dang / badzra dang / sam kri ti dang / pr'a m'a ta dang / bya ghra p'a ta dang / aa dza dang bed dang bhu ma zhes sogs rnams ni garga sogs rnams so /
translated: Garga, Vāmana, Vajra, Saṃkṛti, Prāmāṇa, Vyāghrapāda, Aśvajit, Bṛhaspati, Bhūmi, and so on are Garga and so on.

original: yaska dang / ladzdza dang / dru ha dang / aa ya sth'u na dang / bha lan dha ra zhes pa la sogs pa yaska sogs rnams so //
analyzed: yaska dang / ladzdza dang / dru ha dang / aa ya sth'u na dang / bha lan dha ra zhes pa la sogs pa yaska sogs rnams so //
translated: Yaka, Laja, Druha, Ayasthūṇa, Bhalandhara, and so on are Yaka and so on.

original: bi da dang / aurba dang / bha ra dhv'a dza dang / kurba ts'a ra dang / au pa ma n+yu ka shya pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ni bi da sogs so //🔽bhri gu / aa ti /
analyzed: bi da dang / aurba dang / bha ra dhv'a dza dang / kurba ts'a ra dang / au pa ma n+yu ka shya pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnams ni bi da sogs so // bhri gu / aa ti /
translated: Vid, Urva, Bharadvāja, Kurubhadra, Upamaṃyukāśyapa, and so on are Vid and so on.🔽Bhṛgu, Atri,

original: aam gi ras /
analyzed: aam gi ras /
translated: Aṅgiras,

original: kut+sa ba shishtha /
analyzed: kut+sa ba shishtha /
translated: Kutsa, Vasiṣṭha,

original: go ta ma rnams las kyang ngo //
analyzed: go ta ma rnams las kyang ngo //
translated: and Gautama.

original: bhri gu dang / aa ti dang / aam gi ras dang / kut+sa dang / ba shishtha dang / go tam zhes pa 'di rnams las pha rol gyi bud med min pa'i bu rgyud kyi rkyen mang po nyid du skyes pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bhri gu dang / aa ti dang / aam gi ras dang / kut+sa dang / ba shishtha dang / go tam zhes pa 'di rnams las pha rol gyi bud med min pa'i bu rgyud kyi rkyen mang po nyid du skyes pa 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhr̥gu, Aṭri, Aṅgiras, Kutsa, Vasiṣṭha, and Gautama—from these many sons are born who are not the sons of other women.

original: bhri gu'i bu rgyud mang po rnams ni /
analyzed: bhri gu'i bu rgyud mang po rnams ni /
translated: The many sons of Bhr̥gu

original: bhri ga wa:/ aa tra ya:/
analyzed: bhri ga wa:/ aa tra ya:/
translated: are Bhr̥gava, Aṭraya,

original: aam gi ras /
analyzed: aam gi ras /
translated: Aṅgiras,🔽Kutsa,

original: kutv'a:/ ba shishtha:/ got m'a:/
analyzed: kutv'a:/ ba shishtha:/ got m'a:/
translated: Vasiṣṭha, and Gautama.

original: aa tri'i sgra las bud med dang aa tri sogs las so ae yana'o zhes pas ae yana'o //
analyzed: aa tri'i sgra las bud med dang aa tri sogs las so ae yana'o zhes pas ae yana'o //
translated: From the word Aṭri, a woman, and from Aṭri and so on, a woman, is Eyani.

original: lhag ma rnams las bu rgyud la aan yang na'o zhes pas aana'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las bu rgyud la aan yang na'o zhes pas aana'o //
translated: From the remaining [words], in the lineage, is Ani.

original: de dag 'jig go //
analyzed: de dag 'jig go //
translated: They are destroyed.

original: mang po nyid kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: mang po nyid kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by many?

original: bhri gu'i bu rgyud ni /
analyzed: bhri gu'i bu rgyud ni /
translated: The many sons of Bhr̥gu

original: bh'arga wa:/ a'a tre ya:/
analyzed: bh'arga wa:/ a'a tre ya:/
translated: are Bhr̥gava, Aṭreya,

original: aam gir sa:/ koot+sa:/
analyzed: aam gir sa:/ koot+sa:/
translated: Aṅgirasa, Kutsa,

original: w'ashishtha:/ goo ta ma:/
analyzed: w'ashishtha:/ goo ta ma:/
translated: Vasiṣṭha, and Gautama.

original: bud med ma yin pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bud med ma yin pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not a woman?🔽The many sons of Bhr̥gu's women

original: bhri gu'i bud med kyi bu rgyud rnams ni /
analyzed: bhri gu'i bud med kyi bu rgyud rnams ni /
translated: are

original: bharga bya:/ a'a tra yya:/
analyzed: bharga bya:/ a'a tra yya:/
translated: bharga-vyāḥ, a-tra-yāḥ,

original: aa'ang gi ra sya:/
analyzed: aa'ang gi ra sya:/
translated: aṅgirasyaḥ,

original: koo ta sya:/ w'a shishthya:/
analyzed: koo ta sya:/ w'a shishthya:/
translated: kauṭasyaḥ, vaśiṣṭhyaḥ,🔽gautamāḥ, e-yāna-byāsāḥ.

original: goo tamya:/ ae yan dang aan byas pa la aan dang ae ya dang ai ka las zhes pas a'i yig go //🔽dzas so // bu rgyud kyi rkyen gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: goo tamya:/ ae yan dang aan byas pa la aan dang ae ya dang ai ka las zhes pas a'i yig go // dzas so // bu rgyud kyi rkyen gyi zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The letter a is added to the names of the disciples of Bhrgu,

original: bhri gu'i slob ma 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: bhri gu'i slob ma 'di rnams ni /
translated: bharga-vyāḥ, a-tra-yāḥ,🔽aṅgirasyaḥ, kauṭasyaḥ, vaśiṣṭhyaḥ, gautamāḥ, e-yāna-byāsāḥ.

original: bharga w'a:/ snga ma ltar aana'o //
analyzed: bharga w'a:/ snga ma ltar aana'o //
translated: The letter a is added to the names of the disciples of Bhrgu,🔽bharga-vyāḥ, a-tra-yāḥ, aṅgirasyaḥ, kauṭasyaḥ, vaśiṣṭhyaḥ, gautamāḥ, e-yāna-byāsāḥ.

original: gang las 'bral ba'am 'jigs pa'am len pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang las 'bral ba'am 'jigs pa'am len pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'o //
translated: From whom there is separation, fear, or taking, that is definitely all-giving.

original: 'bral ba zhes pa tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bral ba zhes pa tshig gnyis te /
translated: Separation is two words.

original: de bzhin du len pa zhes pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du len pa zhes pa'ang ngo //
translated: Similarly, taking is also.

original: gang las 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang las 'bral ba ste /
translated: From whom there is separation,

original: gang las phral ba thob pa dang / gang las 'jigs pa dang gang las lan cing 'dzin pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //🔽gr'a m'a d'a gatstsha ti /
analyzed: gang las phral ba thob pa dang / gang las 'jigs pa dang gang las lan cing 'dzin pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro // gr'a m'a d'a gatstsha ti /
translated: from whom there is attainment of separation, and from whom there is fear and from whom there is taking, that becomes the name of the one who is definitely all-giving.🔽Gramamādā gacchati.

original: gr'a m'a d'a ga mishya ti /
analyzed: gr'a m'a d'a ga mishya ti /
translated: Gramamādā gamiṣyati.

original: aadharm'anni wartta te /
analyzed: aadharm'anni wartta te /
translated: Adharmanivartate.

original: aa shvat pa ti ta:/
analyzed: aa shvat pa ti ta:/
translated: Aśvatapatitāḥ.

original: @119a * // tsoo re bhyo bi bhe ti /
analyzed: @119a * // tsoo re bhyo bi bhe ti /
translated: Caurarbhhyo vibhedi

original: au p'a dhya y'adbi dy'a m'a darte /
analyzed: au p'a dhya y'adbi dy'a m'a darte /
translated: Upādhyāyād vidyā mādarśe

original: koshtha g'a r'a ddha n+ya grihya te /
analyzed: koshtha g'a r'a ddha n+ya grihya te /
translated: Koṣṭhāgārād dhananyagṛhyate

original: 'o na / gr'a m'ann'a gatstsha ti /
analyzed: 'o na / gr'a m'ann'a gatstsha ti /
translated: Grahānna gacchati

original: zhes pa 'dir ci'i phyir nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir ci'i phyir nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can yin te /
translated: Why is it that this is definitely the name of the one who gives everything?

original: 'dir ni phral ba dgag par bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ni phral ba dgag par bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: Here, the separation is to be negated.

original: bden te / ji srid du phral ba bstan par bya ba ma yin de srid du ni su zhig dgag pa yod /
analyzed: bden te / ji srid du phral ba bstan par bya ba ma yin de srid du ni su zhig dgag pa yod /
translated: True, but as long as the separation is not taught, how can there be a negation?

original: des na phral bar gyur pa nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can yod pa de la dgag pa 'brel pa med do //🔽gang las 'brel pa zhes pa 'dis grub pa nyid las len pa /
analyzed: des na phral bar gyur pa nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can yod pa de la dgag pa 'brel pa med do // gang las 'brel pa zhes pa 'dis grub pa nyid las len pa /
translated: Therefore, the negation is not connected to the one who definitely has the name of the one who gives everything, who has become separated.

original: smos pa ni spros pa'i don to //
analyzed: smos pa ni spros pa'i don to //
translated: From where is the connection? By this, it is established that the mention is for the purpose of elaboration.

original: de bzhin du 'jugs zhes smos pa'ang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jugs zhes smos pa'ang ste /
translated: Similarly, the mention of enters is also🔽like that.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: rtsoo bo re bhyo bi bhe sti /
analyzed: rtsoo bo re bhyo bi bhe sti /
translated: Caurarbhhyo vibhedi

original: zhes pa 'dir gang 'jigs par byed pa chom rkun pa ste de las phral bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir gang 'jigs par byed pa chom rkun pa ste de las phral bar bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the one who causes fear is the thief, from whom the separation is to be done.

original: nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming gi gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming gi gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name of the definitely all-giving used?

original: lhag ma rnams las byed pa /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las byed pa /
translated: In the remaining [words].

original: yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa zhes pa 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gis de nyid du dgos so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa zhes pa 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gis de nyid du dgos so //
translated: The word samyak-pradānam here is to be used in the sense of the name that will be explained later.

original: bsrung ba'i don rnams kyis 'dod pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don rnams kyis 'dod pa'ang ngo //
translated: [The word] iṣṭa[m] also has the meaning of protection.

original: gang rnams kyi bsrung ba'i don gyi byings de rnams ni bsrung ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi bsrung ba'i don gyi byings de rnams ni bsrung ba'i don to //
translated: Those roots that have the meaning of protection are [used] in the sense of protection.

original: thos shing rjes su dpag pas brtags pas mdo'i don yongs su brtag go zhes pa'i sbyor ba'i sgra bdun pa'i mtha'i tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: thos shing rjes su dpag pas brtags pas mdo'i don yongs su brtag go zhes pa'i sbyor ba'i sgra bdun pa'i mtha'i tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the sutra should be examined by hearing and inference. The word examination is to be used in the seventh case ending.

original: gang 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa'i bsrung ba'i don gyi byings rnams kyi sbyor bar gyur pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa'i bsrung ba'i don gyi byings rnams kyi sbyor bar gyur pa de nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur te /
translated: Those roots that have the meaning of protection, which are desired and intended, when used in the sense of the definitely all-giving,

original: 'ang gi sgra las 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra las 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yang ngo //
translated: become [words] with the meaning of desire.

original: ya be dhyo g'am raksha ti /
analyzed: ya be dhyo g'am raksha ti /
translated: Yāvad-rakṣati,

original: ti le bhya:k'a k'a nv'a ra ya ti /
analyzed: ti le bhya:k'a k'a nv'a ra ya ti /
translated: tilebhyaḥ kānanavārayati,

original: aa hi bhya:su tram rksha ti /
analyzed: aa hi bhya:su tram rksha ti /
translated: Ahi bhyasutram rakṣati,

original: k'u p'andandham wa ra ya ti /
analyzed: k'u p'andandham wa ra ya ti /
translated: kūpān dandhām varayati.

original: spros pa'i don gyi sbyor ba ste gang las 'bral ba zhes pa 'dis grub pa nyid las so //
analyzed: spros pa'i don gyi sbyor ba ste gang las 'bral ba zhes pa 'dis grub pa nyid las so //
translated: The application of the meaning of prapañca is from the very establishment of what is to be separated by this.

original: nas la sogs pa rnams las ba lang la sogs la phral bar bya ba yod pas so //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa rnams las ba lang la sogs la phral bar bya ba yod pas so //
translated: Because there is separation of cows, etc. from barley, etc.

original: gang gi ched du sbyin par 'dod pa'am sred par byed pa'am 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ched du sbyin par 'dod pa'am sred par byed pa'am 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'o //
translated: That for the sake of which one desires to give, or causes to crave, or causes to grasp, that is to give perfectly.

original: gang gi ched du sbyin par 'dod cing len par 'dod pa dang / gang gi ched du sred par byed pa dang gang gi ched du 'dzin du 'jug pa de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ched du sbyin par 'dod cing len par 'dod pa dang / gang gi ched du sred par byed pa dang gang gi ched du 'dzin du 'jug pa de yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: That for the sake of which one desires to give and desires to take, and that for the sake of which one causes to crave and causes to grasp, that becomes the name of to give perfectly.

original: bi pr'a ya bhi ksham da d'a ti /
analyzed: bi pr'a ya bhi ksham da d'a ti /
translated: Viprayabhikṣaṃ dadāti,

original: au p'a dhy'a y'a ya g'am da d'a ti /🔽de wa datt'a ya ro tsa ti mo da k'a:/
analyzed: au p'a dhy'a y'a ya g'am da d'a ti / de wa datt'a ya ro tsa ti mo da k'a:/
translated: upādhyāyāyagāṃ dadāti,🔽devadattāya rocate mokṣaḥ,

original: yadznya datt'a ya sha tam dh'a ra ya te /
analyzed: yadznya datt'a ya sha tam dh'a ra ya te /
translated: jñānadattāya śatam dhārayate.

original: sbyin par 'dod pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin par 'dod pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the one who is desirous of giving?

original: ra dznyo dandam da d'a ti /
analyzed: ra dznyo dandam da d'a ti /
translated: Rājño dandaḥ pradattaḥ.

original: dbang du gyur pa'i yul la @119b ming 'di 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa'i yul la @119b ming 'di 'dod do //
translated: The object which is under one's control is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: des na gzhan gyi rje bo nyid du gyur pa gang la sbyin pa de la ming 'di'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rje bo nyid du gyur pa gang la sbyin pa de la ming 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, the one to whom the giving is made is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case here.

original: r'a dza ka sya bastram da d'a ti /🔽gang kun nas 'dzin pa de gnas gzhi'o //
analyzed: r'a dza ka sya bastram da d'a ti / gang kun nas 'dzin pa de gnas gzhi'o //
translated: Rājño kasya vṛkṣaḥ pradattaḥ.🔽The one who is the possessor is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: gang la rnam par gnas pa 'dzin par byed pa de kun 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam par gnas pa 'dzin par byed pa de kun 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The one who is the possessor is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: aa dhi a'a ya n+ya yo dyo zhes pas tshig phrad la ghanya'o //
analyzed: aa dhi a'a ya n+ya yo dyo zhes pas tshig phrad la ghanya'o //
translated: Adhi-āyany-udyo.

original: gang kun nas 'dzin pa de gnas gzhi'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang kun nas 'dzin pa de gnas gzhi'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is the possessor is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: da dhni ghri tam /
analyzed: da dhni ghri tam /
translated: Dadhni gṛhītam.🔽Prayaṅgeṣe te.

original: pra yangge she te /
analyzed: pra yangge she te /
translated: Jale mātsyāḥ.

original: dza le m'at+sy'a:/ gang yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'brel pa 'chad par 'dod pa der yang ming du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dza le m'at+sy'a:/ gang yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'brel pa 'chad par 'dod pa der yang ming du 'gyur te /
translated: The one who is the possessor is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: aanggu lya gre hasti yu tha sha ta masti /
analyzed: aanggu lya gre hasti yu tha sha ta masti /
translated: Aṅgulimān-hastī yūtha-śatām-sthiḥ.

original: gang gis bya ba de byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bya ba de byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is the possessor is the one who is desirous of giving.

original: gang gang gis bya ba de byed pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gang gis bya ba de byed pa'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes a name for the action that is done by whatever.

original: d'a tre na lu n'a ti /
analyzed: d'a tre na lu n'a ti /
translated: Dātre, lunā,

original: pa ra shu n'atstshi ni ti /
analyzed: pa ra shu n'atstshi ni ti /
translated: parasūnācchinī,

original: gang gi tshe spyod pa sogs ni skyes bu'i bya ba la ltos pa med pa de'i tshe byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyod pa sogs ni skyes bu'i bya ba la ltos pa med pa de'i tshe byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the action and so on do not depend on the action of a person, then it does not become an agent.

original: d'a tram lu n'a ti /
analyzed: d'a tram lu n'a ti /
translated: Dātram lunā,

original: gang bya ba de las so //
analyzed: gang bya ba de las so //
translated: From whatever action.

original: gang bya ba de las kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bya ba de las kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes a name for the action.

original: ka tam ka ro ti /
analyzed: ka tam ka ro ti /
translated: Katam karoti,

original: ao da nam pa tsa ti /
analyzed: ao da nam pa tsa ti /
translated: odanama pacati,

original: a'a di tyam pa shya ti /
analyzed: a'a di tyam pa shya ti /
translated: ādityam paśyati,

original: aa dhi snga ma rnams kyi shing dang stha dang a'asti zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la kun 'dzin pa'i las kyi ming can du bshad par bya ste /🔽gr'a ma ma dhi she te /
analyzed: aa dhi snga ma rnams kyi shing dang stha dang a'asti zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la kun 'dzin pa'i las kyi ming can du bshad par bya ste / gr'a ma ma dhi she te /
translated: The application of these previous words such as śin, stha, and asti should be explained as having the name of the action of holding.🔽Grāmamadhiśete,

original: gr'a ma ma dhi tishtha ti /
analyzed: gr'a ma ma dhi tishtha ti /
translated: grāmamadhitisthati,

original: gr'a ma ma bhya te /
analyzed: gr'a ma ma bhya te /
translated: grāmam abhyāte,

original: dus dang dngos po dang la dang yul rnams kyi las med pa'i byings dag gi sbyor ba la las kyi ming can du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dus dang dngos po dang la dang yul rnams kyi las med pa'i byings dag gi sbyor ba la las kyi ming can du bshad par bya ste /
translated: The application of the roots without the case endings of time, thing, la, and place should be explained as having the name of the action.

original: dus kyi ni /
analyzed: dus kyi ni /
translated: Of time:

original: m'a sa ma sti /
analyzed: m'a sa ma sti /
translated: māsaṃsti

original: dngos po'i ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i ni /
translated: Of things:

original: go do ha ma sti /
analyzed: go do ha ma sti /
translated: godohastis

original: lam gyi ni /
analyzed: lam gyi ni /
translated: Of the path:

original: kro sha ma sti /
analyzed: kro sha ma sti /
translated: krośastis

original: yul gyi ni /
analyzed: yul gyi ni /

original: ku tun sva pi ti /
analyzed: ku tun sva pi ti /

original: bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi 'ang ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi 'ang ste /

analyzed: so bha nam pa tsa ti / gang byed mkhan de byed pa po'o //
translated: sobhāpacati🔽The agent of that is the doer.

original: gang byed mkhan de byed pa po'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang byed mkhan de byed pa po'i ming can du 'gyur ro //

original: ru dre na kri tam /
analyzed: ru dre na kri tam /

original: bishnun'a kri tam /
analyzed: bishnun'a kri tam /

analyzed: byed pa po'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /

analyzed: byed ba bo la'ang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //

original: gang byed du 'jug pa de rgyu 'ang ngo //
analyzed: gang byed du 'jug pa de rgyu 'ang ngo //
translated: That which is made to do is the cause.

original: byed pa po smos pa rjes su 'brel bar bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa po smos pa rjes su 'brel bar bya ste /

original: gang byed pa po dang rjes su 'jug pa de rgyu'i ming can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang byed pa po dang rjes su 'jug pa de rgyu'i ming can du 'gyur te /
translated: That which is connected with the agent becomes the name of the cause.

original: 'ang gi sgra las byad pa po'i ming can yang po /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra las byad pa po'i ming can yang po /
translated: From the word 'also', the name of the agent is also.

original: k'a ra ya ti /
analyzed: k'a ra ya ti /
translated: kārayati🔽pāthayati🔽duṣkṛt

original: p'a tha ya ti /🔽du kriny byed pa la'o //🔽batha klog pa la'o //
analyzed: p'a tha ya ti /🔽du kriny byed pa la'o //🔽batha klog pa la'o //
translated: pāṭha

original: byed du 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: It causes one to engage in making.🔽It causes one to engage in reading.

original: klog tu 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do zhes pa dang byings kyi'ang rgyu la'o zhes pas @120a * //
analyzed: klog tu 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do zhes pa dang byings kyi'ang rgyu la'o zhes pas @120a * //
translated: And also from the verbal root, in the cause.

original: aina'o // aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas 'phel ba dang ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aina'o // aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas 'phel ba dang ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of the increase and lengthening is by the aṇ affix and the upadhā affix.

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //🔽yod tan no //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o // yod tan no //
translated: The cause of the change is by the aṇ affix and the vibhaktikāraṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.

original: rgyu'i ming yod pa de la rgyu'i don la aina'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i ming yod pa de la rgyu'i don la aina'o //
translated: The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.

original: byed pa po'i ming med pa na ain dang nya dang yaa dza sogs las gnyi ga'o zhes pas pa ra smee'i tshig go //🔽rgyu'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: byed pa po'i ming med pa na ain dang nya dang yaa dza sogs las gnyi ga'o zhes pas pa ra smee'i tshig go // rgyu'i ming gis gang du dgos she na /
translated: The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.

original: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pas 'dir ro //🔽de rnams kyi gnyis thob pa la pha rol lo //
analyzed: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pas 'dir ro // de rnams kyi gnyis thob pa la pha rol lo //
translated: The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.🔽The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.

original: gnyis ka dag gi thob pa ni gnyis ka thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag gi thob pa ni gnyis ka thob pa'o //
translated: The cause of the existence is by the aṇ affix and the yāṇ affix.

original: gal te yang /🔽au bha ya'i sgra tshig sdud la thob pa de lta na yang au bha'i sgras tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te yang /🔽au bha ya'i sgra tshig sdud la thob pa de lta na yang au bha'i sgras tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The cause of

original: gnyis nyid kyi yul la au bha ya'i sgra sbyor ba mi srid pas so //
analyzed: gnyis nyid kyi yul la au bha ya'i sgra sbyor ba mi srid pas so //
translated: It is impossible to apply the word ubhaya to a dual object.

original: au bha ya'i sgra ni gcig nyid dang mang po nyid dag la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: au bha ya'i sgra ni gcig nyid dang mang po nyid dag la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ubhaya should be applied to singularity and plurality.

original: au bha'i sgra'i gnyis nyid la'o //
analyzed: au bha'i sgra'i gnyis nyid la'o //
translated: The word ubhaya is for duality.

original: de rnams kyi ste nges par kun sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byed pa can rnams kyi nang nas gnyis ka dag gi ste byed pa can gnyis dag yul gcig la thob pa gang yin pa'i pha rol na yod pa'i byed pa can de kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ste nges par kun sbyin pa la sogs pa'i byed pa can rnams kyi nang nas gnyis ka dag gi ste byed pa can gnyis dag yul gcig la thob pa gang yin pa'i pha rol na yod pa'i byed pa can de kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, those having the activity of giving everything, etc., the two of them, having the activity of two, obtain the same object. That which exists beyond the activity becomes just that.

original: bri ksham tya dza ti kha ga: 'dir shing las bya phral bar bya'o zhes briksha la nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can thob pa la shing dang 'brel bzhin pa nyid las /
analyzed: bri ksham tya dza ti kha ga: 'dir shing las bya phral bar bya'o zhes briksha la nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can thob pa la shing dang 'brel bzhin pa nyid las /
translated: Here, in cutting the tree, the name of the one who gives everything, which is determined by the tree, is obtained. From the very connection with the tree,

original: las su 'gyur ro zhes las kyi ming can yang 'gyur ba las pha rol nyid kyi phyir las kyi ming can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las su 'gyur ro zhes las kyi ming can yang 'gyur ba las pha rol nyid kyi phyir las kyi ming can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes the name of the action. Because it exists beyond the action, it becomes only the name of the action.

original: tya dza ti dandam dand'i 'dir dbyug pa can las dbyug pa phral bar bya'o zhes dandi la nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can thob pa la'o //
analyzed: tya dza ti dandam dand'i 'dir dbyug pa can las dbyug pa phral bar bya'o zhes dandi la nges par kun sbyin pa'i ming can thob pa la'o //
translated: In the expression tyajati dandam, “he lays down the stick,” the word dandam is in the accusative case, because it is the object of the verb “to lay down.”

original: dbyug pa can las dbyug pa 'brel pa na yang byed pa po nyid du yod do zhes byed pa po'i ming can 'ang 'gyur mod pha rol nyid kyi phyir las kyi ming can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyug pa can las dbyug pa 'brel pa na yang byed pa po nyid du yod do zhes byed pa po'i ming can 'ang 'gyur mod pha rol nyid kyi phyir las kyi ming can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the word dandam were in the instrumental case, “by the stick,” then it would be the instrument of the action, and the word would be in the instrumental case.

original: sngar bshad pa dang phyis brjod pas yongs su bshad pa nyid kyis grub pa las sbyor ba brtsams pa 'di lta bu ni spros pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dang phyis brjod pas yongs su bshad pa nyid kyis grub pa las sbyor ba brtsams pa 'di lta bu ni spros pa'i don to //
translated: The purpose of this discussion is to show that the words of a treatise are not to be taken literally, but are to be interpreted in the light of the author’s intention.

original: rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o //
analyzed: rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o //
translated: The first case is the case of the reason.

original: rtags kyi don ni rtags don no //🔽de'i tshig ni rtags kyi don gyi tshig go //
analyzed: rtags kyi don ni rtags don no // de'i tshig ni rtags kyi don gyi tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the reason is the reason’s meaning.🔽The words of the reason’s meaning are the words of the reason’s meaning.

original: rtags kyi don gyi tshig mngon par brjod par gyur pa la rtags rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags kyi don gyi tshig mngon par brjod par gyur pa la rtags rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The first case is the case of the words of the reason’s meaning.

original: de las pha rol zhes pa 'dis si la sogs pa rnams grub pa nyid las 'on kyang rab tu byed pa 'di ni 'di tla bu'i don gyi tshig can gyi don la @120b brtsam par bya'o /
analyzed: de las pha rol zhes pa 'dis si la sogs pa rnams grub pa nyid las 'on kyang rab tu byed pa 'di ni 'di tla bu'i don gyi tshig can gyi don la @120b brtsam par bya'o /
translated: The word beyond in the phrase beyond that is a word that expresses the meaning of the word beyond in the phrase beyond that.🔽 bṛkṣaḥ,

original: bri ksha:/ ku m'a r'i /
analyzed: bri ksha:/ ku m'a r'i /
translated: kumārī,🔽kuṇḍaḥ,🔽droṇaḥ,

original: kundam / dron:/ a'at kam /
analyzed: kundam / dron:/ a'at kam /
translated: āṭakaḥ,

original: rtags kyi don la zhes bya ba la tshig smos pam ni gang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa de la yang dang po 'jug ba'i don to /
analyzed: rtags kyi don la zhes bya ba la tshig smos pam ni gang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa de la yang dang po 'jug ba'i don to /
translated: In the meaning of the sign means that the word also expresses the nature of the meanings of words such as one and so on, and it also has the meaning of engaging in the beginning.🔽ekaḥ,🔽dve,

original: aek:/ dvoo / ba ha wa /
analyzed: aek:/ dvoo / ba ha wa /
translated: bahu,

original: 'dir ae ka'i sgras gcig nyid brjod cing dvi'i sgras gnyis dang ba hu'i sgras mang po nyid do /
analyzed: 'dir ae ka'i sgras gcig nyid brjod cing dvi'i sgras gnyis dang ba hu'i sgras mang po nyid do /
translated: Here, the word eka expresses one, the word dve expresses two, and the word bahu expresses many.

original: rnam dbye smos pa ni de ltar dgos pa ldan pa'o zhes gsung ngo /
analyzed: rnam dbye smos pa ni de ltar dgos pa ldan pa'o zhes gsung ngo /
translated: It is said that the use of the case ending is for the purpose of expressing that it is necessary in that way.

original: bod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: bod pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in Tibetan.

original: bod pa'i don la rtags las rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro //🔽he sham ka ra /
analyzed: bod pa'i don la rtags las rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro // he sham ka ra /
translated: In the Tibetan meaning, the case ending becomes first from the sign.🔽heśaṃkara,🔽hekraḥ,

original: he krishna / he briksha /
analyzed: he krishna / he briksha /
translated: hevajrā,

original: 'o na snga mas grub yod do zhes pas ci ltar sbyor ba brtsams she na /
analyzed: 'o na snga mas grub yod do zhes pas ci ltar sbyor ba brtsams she na /
translated: Well, if the former is established, how does one apply the latter?

original: de ni yang ngag ma yin te 'dir bod la lhag pa ni rtags kyi don du rtogs so zhes pas rtags kyi don dgag pa med pa'i phyir mdo byas pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang ngag ma yin te 'dir bod la lhag pa ni rtags kyi don du rtogs so zhes pas rtags kyi don dgag pa med pa'i phyir mdo byas pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because here in Tibetan, the remainder is understood as the meaning of the reason, and because the meaning of the reason is not negated, the sutra is not meaningless.

original: lhag ma rnams las byed pa yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa nges par kun sbyin pa rje bo la sogs pa gzhi rnams la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las byed pa yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa nges par kun sbyin pa rje bo la sogs pa gzhi rnams la'o //
translated: The remainder is the correct giving of the action, the giving of the definite, to the bases such as the master and so on.

original: sgra gang rnams kyi dang po rje bo yin pa de rnams ni rje bo la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sgra gang rnams kyi dang po rje bo yin pa de rnams ni rje bo la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those terms whose first is the master are the master and so on.

original: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Then there is the compound.

original: rje bo la sogs pa'i sgras sbyor ba smos pa ni dkyus ma spong ba yin no //
analyzed: rje bo la sogs pa'i sgras sbyor ba smos pa ni dkyus ma spong ba yin no //
translated: The mention of the compound with the term master and so on is to exclude the ordinary.

original: lhag ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams ni las byed pa dang yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa dang nges par kun sbyin pa dang rje bo la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang gzhi rnams las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams ni las byed pa dang yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa dang nges par kun sbyin pa dang rje bo la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang gzhi rnams las 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining cases, the second and so on, are formed from the application of the suffixes to the bases, such as kṛ, “to do,” and to the roots, such as svām, “lord.”

original: las la gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: las la gnyis pa ste /
translated: There are two suffixes for the nominative case.

original: ka tam ka ro ti /
analyzed: ka tam ka ro ti /
translated: katam karoti.

original: las brjod pa la ma'i 'gyur te brjod pa'i don rnams kyi sbyor ba la ma yin no zhes pa'i tshigs las so //
analyzed: las brjod pa la ma'i 'gyur te brjod pa'i don rnams kyi sbyor ba la ma yin no zhes pa'i tshigs las so //
translated: The suffix ta is added to the verbal root, but not to the nominal roots, the meanings of which are expressed.

original: kri ya te ka ta:/
analyzed: kri ya te ka ta:/
translated: kṛtya te kṛt.

original: 'dir a'atma ne'i tshig gis las brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir a'atma ne'i tshig gis las brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the suffix ta is added because the nominative case is expressed by the word ātmanepada.

original: kri ta:/ ka ta:/
analyzed: kri ta:/ ka ta:/
translated: kṛt ka.

original: 'dir yang rkyen gyis brjod pas so //
analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen gyis brjod pas so //
translated: Here also the nominative case is expressed by the suffix.

original: byed pa la gsum pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa la gsum pa ste /
translated: There are three suffixes for the accusative case.

original: pa ra shu n'atstshi na ti /
analyzed: pa ra shu n'atstshi na ti /
translated: parāśu naccina ti.

original: yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa la bzhi pa ste /🔽au p'a dhy'a y'a ya g'am da d'a ti /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa la bzhi pa ste / au p'a dhy'a y'a ya g'am da d'a ti /
translated: There are four suffixes for the dative case.🔽upādhyāya yāgam dadāti.

original: zhes par kun sbyin pa la lnga pa ste /
analyzed: zhes par kun sbyin pa la lnga pa ste /
translated: There are five suffixes for the ablative case.

original: gr'a m'a d'a ga ta:/
analyzed: gr'a m'a d'a ga ta:/
translated: grāmāt āgataḥ.

original: rje bo la sogs pa sbyor ba la drug pa ste /
analyzed: rje bo la sogs pa sbyor ba la drug pa ste /
translated: There are six suffixes for the genitive case.

original: de wa datta sya sv'a m'i /🔽yadzny'a datta sya sv'a m'i /
analyzed: de wa datta sya sv'a m'i / yadzny'a datta sya sv'a m'i /
translated: Of Devadatta.🔽Of Jñānadatta.

original: tstsha tr'a n'am mu h'a:/
analyzed: tstsha tr'a n'am mu h'a:/
translated: Of the two Cāṇḍāla boys.

original: bzhi la bdun pa ste /🔽ka te a'a te /
analyzed: bzhi la bdun pa ste / ka te a'a te /
translated: The fourth is the seventh.🔽Of the two Kātyāyanas.

original: au bha ya dang sarba zhes pa'i 'di dag la tas sbyor ba la gnyis pa bshad par bya ste /🔽au bha ya te gr'a mam ba sa ti /
analyzed: au bha ya dang sarba zhes pa'i 'di dag la tas sbyor ba la gnyis pa bshad par bya ste / au bha ya te gr'a mam ba sa ti /
translated: Of the two Udayas.

original: sarba to na ga ra ba sa ti /
analyzed: sarba to na ga ra ba sa ti /
translated: Of the two Sarvas.🔽Of the two of all.

original: gnyis ka @121a * //
analyzed: gnyis ka @121a * //
translated: Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.

original: la thams cad la zhes a'a di sogs las tas so zhes pas tas so //🔽ha dang dhi ka'i sgra sbyor ba la'ang ngo //
analyzed: la thams cad la zhes a'a di sogs las tas so zhes pas tas so // ha dang dhi ka'i sgra sbyor ba la'ang ngo //
translated: Of the two of all.

original: h'a de wa datti /🔽hrigdewadattam / ha'i sgra sbyor ba la dang po yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: h'a de wa datti / hrigdewadattam / ha'i sgra sbyor ba la dang po yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.

original: h'a de wa datta:/
analyzed: h'a de wa datta:/
translated: Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.

original: aa bhi tas dang sa ri tas dang sa ma y'a dang ni ka s'a zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: aa bhi tas dang sa ri tas dang sa ma y'a dang ni ka s'a zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la yang ngo //
translated: Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.

original: aa bhi to gr'a mam wa sa ti /
analyzed: aa bhi to gr'a mam wa sa ti /
translated: Of the two of all.

original: grong gnyis po zhes pa'i don to //🔽pa ri to na ga ram ba sa ti /
analyzed: grong gnyis po zhes pa'i don to //🔽pa ri to na ga ram ba sa ti /
translated: Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.🔽Of the two of all.

original: grong khyer kun zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: grong khyer kun zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of all is the meaning of city.

original: aa bhi dang pa ri dag las gnyis kyi don dang thams cad kyi don la tas so //
analyzed: aa bhi dang pa ri dag las gnyis kyi don dang thams cad kyi don la tas so //
translated: The meaning of both and the meaning of all are from ta in abhi and pari.

original: sa ma y'a gr'a mam /
analyzed: sa ma y'a gr'a mam /
translated: Samaya garmam.

original: sa ma ya dang ni k'a si'i sgra dag ni nye ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: sa ma ya dang ni k'a si'i sgra dag ni nye ba'i tshig go //
translated: Samaya and ni are near words.

original: aanta ra dang aanta re na zhes pa 'di dag gi sbyor ba la yang ngo /
analyzed: aanta ra dang aanta re na zhes pa 'di dag gi sbyor ba la yang ngo /
translated: The application of these, antara and antaran is also.

original: aanta ra tvam tsa m'anytsa gha ta aanta ra ni nang ra ni nang ma zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aanta ra tvam tsa m'anytsa gha ta aanta ra ni nang ra ni nang ma zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Antaratvaṃ ca manyacchat antaran means inside and innermost.

original: aanta re na pu ru sha k'am ram kinytsid pra sya te /
analyzed: aanta re na pu ru sha k'am ram kinytsid pra sya te /
translated: Antareṇa puruṣakāram kiñcit prasyate.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa med par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa med par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Without human effort is the meaning.

original: pra kri ti la sogs pa rnams las gsum pa bshad par bya ste ;🔽pra kri tyadarsha n'i ya:/
analyzed: pra kri ti la sogs pa rnams las gsum pa bshad par bya ste ; pra kri tyadarsha n'i ya:/
translated: The third case of prakṛti and so on will be explained.🔽Prakṛtyadṛṣṭayā yājayet.

original: pr'a yena y'a dznya ka:/
analyzed: pr'a yena y'a dznya ka:/
translated: Prāyeṇa yā jñākaḥ.

original: go tre na g'argya:/
analyzed: go tre na g'argya:/
translated: Gotreṇa gacchati.

original: gang pra kri ti la sogs pa'i sgra de rnams kyi byed pa po dang / byed pa dag ma gtogs pa la gsum pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang pra kri ti la sogs pa'i sgra de rnams kyi byed pa po dang / byed pa dag ma gtogs pa la gsum pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third case of those words such as prakṛti should be seen except for the agent and the action.

original: pri tha ka dang bi n'a dang / n'i n'a rnams kyi sbyor ba la gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang lnga pa bshad par bya ste /🔽pri thagde ba dattam /
analyzed: pri tha ka dang bi n'a dang / n'i n'a rnams kyi sbyor ba la gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang lnga pa bshad par bya ste / pri thagde ba dattam /
translated: The second, third and fifth are to be explained in the compound of prthak, vinā and nīlā.🔽prthak devadatta

original: pri thagde ba datte na /
analyzed: pri thagde ba datte na /
translated: prthak devadatte

original: pri thagde ba datt'ad /
analyzed: pri thagde ba datt'ad /
translated: prthak devadatta

original: de bzhin du bi n'a dang n'a na'i sgra sbyor ba dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bi n'a dang n'a na'i sgra sbyor ba dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the words vinā and nīlā should be exemplified in the compound.

original: sha ba'i byings kyi sbyor ba la bzhi pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sha ba'i byings kyi sbyor ba la bzhi pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The fourth is to be explained in the compound of the śava base.

original: ngag gis lus kyi dal bu'i don la'o //
analyzed: ngag gis lus kyi dal bu'i don la'o //
translated: In the meaning of the body's slowness by speech.

original: de ba datt'a ya sha pa te /
analyzed: de ba datt'a ya sha pa te /
translated: devadatta āśayate

original: spri ha'i sbyor ba la 'dod pa'i don la'o //🔽ru dr'a ya spri ha ya ti /
analyzed: spri ha'i sbyor ba la 'dod pa'i don la'o // ru dr'a ya spri ha ya ti /
translated: In the compound of spṛhā, in the meaning of desire.🔽rudrāya spṛhayati

original: tad rthe y'u p'a ya d'a ru //🔽hi ta sbyor ba la te /
analyzed: tad rthe y'u p'a ya d'a ru // hi ta sbyor ba la te /
translated: tadarthāya dāru

original: de b'a ya hi tam /
analyzed: de b'a ya hi tam /
translated: In the compound of hita, in the meaning of that.🔽devāya hitaṃ

original: ya sa'i sgra'i mtha' phyis pa na mas dang bzhi dag la lnga pa bshad par bya ste /🔽pr'a s'a d'a y'a ru hya preksha te /
analyzed: ya sa'i sgra'i mtha' phyis pa na mas dang bzhi dag la lnga pa bshad par bya ste / pr'a s'a d'a y'a ru hya preksha te /
translated: When the final sound of yasa is elided, the fifth is to be explained in the four cases of ma and sa.🔽prāsāda āyāruhya prekṣate

original: pr'a s'a d'atprekshate /
analyzed: pr'a s'a d'atprekshate /
translated: prāsāda āruhya prekṣate

original: a'a sa ne au pa bi shya bi ksha te /
analyzed: a'a sa ne au pa bi shya bi ksha te /
translated: āsane upaviśya vikṣate

original: a'a sa n'a ta biksha te /
analyzed: a'a sa n'a ta biksha te /
translated: The word āsana means having sat down.

original: ru ha sa bon la'o //
analyzed: ru ha sa bon la'o //
translated: The word ruha means to climb.

original: a'ang lnga ma'o //
analyzed: a'ang lnga ma'o //
translated: The word aṅga means five.

original: bi sha 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: bi sha 'jug pa la'o //
translated: The word viśa means to enter.

original: aup lnga mar ro //
analyzed: aup lnga mar ro //
translated: The word upa means five.

original: byed pa po gcig dag go zhes pas kta'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig dag go zhes pas kta'o //
translated: The word kata is used when there is one agent.

original: bsdu ba ma 'byung ba la zhes pas de'i yas\ tu bsgyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba ma 'byung ba la zhes pas de'i yas\ tu bsgyur ro //
translated: The word anupalabdhi is used when there is no collection.

original: dbyi bar bya'o zhes pas 'os pa'i rkyen nges par bstan pa las aa ru hya dang au pa bi shya dag gi dbyi'o //
analyzed: dbyi bar bya'o zhes pas 'os pa'i rkyen nges par bstan pa las aa ru hya dang au pa bi shya dag gi dbyi'o //
translated: The word arūhya and the word upaviśya are used in the sense of having gone up and having sat down, respectively.

original: rgyu mtshan las las @121b la sbyor bal la bdun bshad par bya ste /🔽tsarma ni dvi pi nam hanti /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan las las @121b la sbyor bal la bdun bshad par bya ste / tsarma ni dvi pi nam hanti /
translated: The seven cases are explained in the context of the reason and action.🔽 The word carman means the skin of two cows.

original: pags pa'i rgyun la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: pags pa'i rgyun la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means the skin of two cows.

original: de bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du //
translated: Similarly,

original: danta yattanti kunydzva ram /
analyzed: danta yattanti kunydzva ram /
translated: The word danta means the tusk of an elephant.

original: ke sheshu tsa ma r'i hanti /
analyzed: ke sheshu tsa ma r'i hanti /
translated: The word keśa means the hair of a goat.

original: s'i m+ni pushpa la ko ha ta:/
analyzed: s'i m+ni pushpa la ko ha ta:/
translated: The word sīmani means the flower of the earth.🔽 In the context of all-inclusive reasons, all cases are used.

original: thams cad pa'i ming can gyi rgyun mtshan gyi sbyor ba la rnam dbye thams cad 'dod de /🔽kinni mittam ba ba ti /
analyzed: thams cad pa'i ming can gyi rgyun mtshan gyi sbyor ba la rnam dbye thams cad 'dod de / kinni mittam ba ba ti /
translated: The word kiṃnitta means the thing to be done.🔽 The word kenittha means by whom it is done.

original: ken ni mitte na /
analyzed: ken ni mitte na /
translated: The word kasminnitthā means where it is done.

original: kasmee ni mitt'a ya /
analyzed: kasmee ni mitt'a ya /
translated: The word kimnitthā means what is done.🔽 The word kathaṃnitthā means how it is done.

original: kasm'anni mi t'a ta /🔽ka sya ni mitta sya /
analyzed: kasm'anni mi t'a ta / ka sya ni mitta sya /
translated: kasyanimittāt?🔽kasyānimittasya?

original: kasm'i nni mitte /
analyzed: kasm'i nni mitte /
translated: kasyānimitte?

original: rgyu mtshan zhes pa 'dir don gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes pa 'dir don gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The word nimitta here should be taken to mean object.

original: des na / kim k'a ra na wa sa ti /
analyzed: des na / kim k'a ra na wa sa ti /
translated: Therefore, kim kāraṇenavasti?

original: ko he tu ra wa sa ti /
analyzed: ko he tu ra wa sa ti /
translated: ko heturavati?

original: kem pra yo dza nam wa sa ti /
analyzed: kem pra yo dza nam wa sa ti /
translated: kem prayojanenavasti?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'ang gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i 'ang gnas so //
translated: and so on.

original: pa ri aa pa a'ang sbyor ba la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: pa ri aa pa a'ang sbyor ba la lnga pa'o //
translated: The application of pari, apa, and aṃ is the fifth.

original: pa ri dang aa pa dang a'ang dang a'ang ste de rnams ni pa ri aap a'ang ngo //
analyzed: pa ri dang aa pa dang a'ang dang a'ang ste de rnams ni pa ri aap a'ang ngo //
translated: Pari, apa, and aṃ are the pari, apa, and aṃ.

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni pa ri aa pa a'ang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni pa ri aa pa a'ang sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of those is the application of pari, apa, and aṃ.

original: pa ri dang aa pa dang a'ang zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la rtags las lnga par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa ri dang aa pa dang a'ang zhes pa 'di rnams kyi sbyor ba la rtags las lnga par 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of these pari, apa, and aṃ becomes the fifth from the sign.

original: las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyis kyang po zhes pas gnyis pa thob pa la'o //
analyzed: las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyis kyang po zhes pas gnyis pa thob pa la'o //
translated: And by the expressions of action, the second is obtained by the word po.

original: pa ri shru ghn'adde wo brishta:/
analyzed: pa ri shru ghn'adde wo brishta:/
translated: Pari śrughnaṃ de'vo briṣṭaḥ.

original: aa pa ka n+ya /
analyzed: aa pa ka n+ya /
translated: Apa kaṇyā.

original: kubdz'adde bo brishta:/ a'a ku ru kshe de wo brishta:/
analyzed: kubdz'adde bo brishta:/ a'a ku ru kshe de wo brishta:/
translated: Kubjaṃ devo briṣṭaḥ. Ā kuru kṣed devo briṣṭaḥ.

original: ba ri aab a'ang zhes bya ba la sbyor ba smos pa ni las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyi bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba ri aab a'ang zhes bya ba la sbyor ba smos pa ni las rab tu brjod pa rnams kyi bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of application in the case of paribhāṣā means the meaning that is taken up by the statements of the rules.

original: nyer bsgyur rnams kyi mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur rnams kyi mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The secondary suffixes are not changed.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not changed here.

original: pa ri bhra ma nam /
analyzed: pa ri bhra ma nam /
translated: paribhramam

original: aa pa sa ra nam /
analyzed: aa pa sa ra nam /
translated: apasāram

original: a'a n'a ya nam /
analyzed: a'a n'a ya nam /
translated: ānayana

original: kri ya'i sbyor bar gyur pa la pa ri sogs rnams nyid kyi nyer bsgyur nyid do zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: kri ya'i sbyor bar gyur pa la pa ri sogs rnams nyid kyi nyer bsgyur nyid do zhes gsung ngo //
translated: In the application of kriyā, parī, etc. are themselves the secondary suffixes.🔽Here,

original: 'dir / 'o na /
analyzed: 'dir / 'o na /
translated: Then,

original: briksham pa ri bi dyo ta te pi dyu ta /
analyzed: briksham pa ri bi dyo ta te pi dyu ta /
translated: brikṣam parividyotate pividyut

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is it not changed?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: aa pa'i sgra'i bor ba'i don la las rab tu brjod par bshad bya ste /
analyzed: aa pa'i sgra'i bor ba'i don la las rab tu brjod par bshad bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the elided [syllable] of the word a is explained as the statement of the rules.

original: de'i phyir bor ba'i don can de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir pa ri'i sgra bor ba'i don can gzung ngo /
analyzed: de'i phyir bor ba'i don can de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir pa ri'i sgra bor ba'i don can gzung ngo /
translated: Therefore, because it is used together with that which has the meaning of the elided [syllable], the word parī which has the meaning of the elided [syllable] is taken.

original: pa ri zhes pa 'dir spang pa ri'i sgra mtshan nyid kyi don du gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: pa ri zhes pa 'dir spang pa ri'i sgra mtshan nyid kyi don du gsal bar byed de /
translated: Here, the word parī is clarified as having the meaning of the characteristic of abandonment.
